description:
After a long work shift, a quick Chinese sit down or takeout always sounds like a viable solution for convenience. Being that for some strange reason, most restaurants in San Francisco seem to close early, options are quite limited. After hopping around to a couple of closed establishments, I luckily stumbled across Tsing Tao and had 30 minutes to spare before they closed their doors for the night too.

I was quickly directed to choose any seat I wanted. The place was empty so I had first pickings. 

The menu looked pretty standard. There were the regular basic dishes you would normally see at any Chinese restaurant. We decided to go with Happy Family and Foil Chicken Appetizer. Both were good and filling. Hot tea was served alongside our meal. Service was efficient and attentive despite leaning towards the closing hours, which was much appreciated. Service goes a long way and they were able to deliver.

Located next to Legion of Honor Museum in a quiet neighborhood, this restaurant pushes out towards Ocean Beach. Street parking is available. They accept debit and credit cards too.
author: Ann S.

description:
This is the regular weekday Chinese restaurant that I go to if I need to order take out just chill out for lunch with a coworker! The food here does have that San Francisco Asian American or British Chinese flavor to it. I'm currently in the area now. I love their menu, you have a wide variety of choices of food to satisfy any cravings you want. At one time I tried their chicken wings and the flavors are on point.  My favorite is the combo chow mein. It's got a lot of different things in in and you pay a really nice price for the plate of food. There are many branches of this restaurant and each one of them live up to the promise of providing great food at a reasonable price. 
Drawback: if you want your food delivered and you live more than five blocks, either pay for delivery or drive and find parking nearby.
author: Michael W.

description: We tried to eat here since their hours said they were open until 10:00pm. We arrived at 9:25pm, and the workers said they're closed. I asked why does their sign say they close at 10:00pm then, and they had no explanation nor were they apologetic. Not the greatest customer service.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Best pork buns I've ever had in my life. The first time I had them, I was thinking about them for days afterwards then had them two more times within 2 weeks. 

Super nice and friendly owners. Definitely the kind of neighborhood joint worth supporting.
author: Jungwon B.

description: My grandma's favorite restaurant. It's around the corner from her. She is no longer with us. My mom & I decided to eat here. Very clean Chinese restaurant. Excellent service. Delicious hot & sour soup. Our luncheon special was a huge plate. Under $ 10. They don't have these kind of restaurant any more
author: Rickey Y.

description: Was quite disappointed with the quality of the food, both my roommate at I. Tasted rushed and just thrown together with little flavor youd expect in the dishes. The pork spring rolls was solely why they got a 2 star instead of 1 :/
author: Matt S.

description: This review is long overdue. In our little neighborhood in the outer Richmond, this place is a gem. My Kids and I have been eating here for about 15 years.  Even the rest of my family when they are in town all come here.  We all enjoy the food.  Not greasy, their potstickers are homemade and delicious!  My son will still only eat their Fried Rice.  No one else's.  And he is now 18.  Always get great service when we sit in.  They are very attentive and nice.  Prices are great for the portion size.  It's rare a place you like has lasted so long in our neighborhood, and we are happy it has.
author: Cat B.

description:
The place looks very bright and clean, and the staff was friendly enough, but the food was just not good. I got takeout. The green onion pancakes were extremely oily. I ate one while it was hot, but I couldn't eat the rest. The fried won-ton were also very oily and soggy, although the filling was tasty.

I also ordered two luncheon dishes over fried rice: twice-cooked pork, and Mandarin sauce chicken. This is standard Chinese fare. How can you screw it up? But the rice was hard and not puffy. Also, many of the bamboo strips that come with the twice-cooked pork were too fibrous too eat. The bamboo is supposed to be tender, not like chewing toothpicks. The dishes were also very lacking in flavor, and while the prices are not high, they are not remarkably low either.
author: Robert H.

description: I had a chicken dish and it was down right gross... never again ... I feel sick to my stomach
author: N J.

description:
Let's start with what I didn't like. I ordered French fries (yes, I know, I have a very picky autistic child) and for almost $9 I expected a lot of fries. Drop that price $3-4 and we'd have a winner. Potstickers were very good, and still atomically hot when they got to me. My only suggestion here would be to ask for extra dipping packets. They give you 1 packets of hot oil and vinegar to mix yourself. The hot oil is very spicy, and there isn't nearly enough for all of the potstickers. I mixed in some sesame oil and rice vinegar I had here at home and problem solved. 
I saved the best for last. The Singapore style noodles.....so good. Nice, big shrimp cooked perfectly. Huge portions, I'm sure I will be eating this later tonight and again at lunch tomorrow. Will definitely be ordering from here again, and so should you.
author: Monica F.

description: Fast delivery . I'm not Asian food lover but this place is good . Not sure why there're not busy :)
author: Ivan S.

description: Tried the house fried rice and chicken fried rice. Green onion pancake. Good taste. Ordered off grubhub while in town.
author: Melissa T.

description: Delicious Chinese delivery food delivered promptly! I usually get pot stickers, chow fun, Singapore noodles, and the seafood soup. The house special eggplant is also delicious. Orange chicken and Moo shu is also good. You can pay by credit or cash.
author: Martha N.

description:
I have always wanted to dine at this outer-Richmond's Chinese restaurant forever. As circulated, one of the restaurant's preferential entrée's is the Dragon Beef.  

So I came here for dinner after shopping at the CVS and Fresh & Easy plaza, which is located across the street. My definite target was indeed the Dragon Beef. For $9.50, I get cubes of beef flanks fried and sautéed in a unique sauce with a colorful broccoli florets surrounding. The dish is classified as a spicy dish. But the dish was not that spicy and very tender. I actually like this entrée. 

I also ordered a plate of vegetable fried rice for $8.95. I get a mixture of Chinese and American broccoli,  frozen peas and carrots and scrambled eggs mixed with rice. "You know I easily eat for two a-holes!"

The restaurant has  a lengthy list of lunch specials that  I may try on the weekdays. They also deliver to the outer Richmond and Sunset District, which is definitely a plus. 

The definite highlight of my dinner is the Dragon Beef, a must try!
author: Matt G.

description: We went through Uber eats and ordered Sesame chicken, fried rice, chow mein, and hot and sour soup. So so disappointed. Everything is just "ok". The chicken is hardly chicken, just mostly fried batter. The chow mein and fried rice are fine, not awesome.... but kinda hard to mess that up. The hot and sour soup is just really bad. Really really bad. I'm so so bummed!!! $50 for a very below average dinner :( I will say though, the delivery was unbelievably fast!!!
author: Kylee P.

description:
I'd give zero stars if i could, but the app won't let me.

I spent $90 On #UberEats to get food from this restaurant delivered just a few miles away so that my wife and I could have a meal with my daughter and her boyfriend. 

The food arrived in time, hot, and good looking, but the good feelings stopped when we started to eat. It was HORRIBLE.
The egg rolls were mushy and inedible. My wife and I both threw the food away. The wonton soup was weird, missing flavor and mysteriously chewy. My wife stopped after one wonton but I ate my portion.
Her happy family (mixed seafood) was bland but edible. My fried beef with Chile sauce was tough and not spicy at all. My daughter and her boyfriend each got orange chicken, which they completely hated. We threw their food away as well as the chicken chow mein.

This really was one of the worst food experiences I've ever had. Hands down awful.
author: Nick M.

description: I had gotten food delivered for years when I lived in the Richmond. They were so fast and delicious! I moved out of The City but still get takeout on my way home from work. I love the hot and sour soup, pork pot stickers, Singapore style noodles, honey walnut prawns, veggie deluxe and eggplant dishes. I've never eaten there, so I can't vouch for that. It's not fancy and there is always a TV playing sports. Go Giants!  They are always polite when I pick up.
author: Alice F.

description: My family has probably been coming here for more than a decade. Truly some of the tastiest Chinese food I've ever had. We've never had a bad experience.
author: Diana B.

description: I been coming here for over 2 decades. Had lots of good times here and probably spent thousands ordering food. It was all fine and all for the first 15 years and lately it's gone downhill rapidly. The food tastes awful these days. Something's off and definitely wrong. I fool myself into thinking it was a fluke and keep coming back for more like an idiot but i'm done now. I'm not going back. I'm sick of bad food here. Quality has gone down and prices have gone up. Whatever you do, don't order their french fries either. They are the absolute worst. Just stay away from this place.
author: Vasily M.

description:
East Coast style Chinesse food. Thin, crisp scallion pancakes, General Tso's chicken, and pots of tea!  

They can sone makes rush you, but what else the is new? 

Worth the drive or Lyft there. Go with an appetite.
author: B K.

description:
I have been waiting for my food to be delivered for an hour now! I ordered my food through the eat 24 app via Yelp. I got a confirmation email order I placed my order the estimated time was 7:49p, it's now been an hour! I ordered pot stickers, fried rice and Kung Pao chicken. Total for the order including tip was $31. I only live 3 blocks away from here I could've walked there and back 3 times within an hour! I have had delivery from here before it didn't take this long! Next time I'm going to order a pizza instead of food from here. I'm really unhappy right now and hungry! 

I called and asked them where is the food I ordered, the guy on the phone was nice and apologized and said it would be another 15-20 mins also asked me if I wanted it still I said yes I still do!
author: Alix J.

description: So cheap, super fast delivery, and great food. One of my favorite late night go-to's
author: Theo B.

description: I had them deliver to my house which I live in the back house so I put instructions on the order to call me and to NOT knock on the door. Although, the guy knocked on my landlords door instead. Then to top it off, I ordered three different things. The vegetable potstickers were not very good. The cheesecake was not anything like the picture. I could have gotten the same thing from the grocery store for much cheaper.
author: Kate C.

description: One of my favorite chinese lunch place. Love their sweet and sour shrimps, another great lunch dish is either garlic shrimps ( u can get chicken or beef ) comes with rice ( u can ask for fried rice or chow mein ) cup of soup, slice of orange and fortine cookie. You cant beat the price !!! Nice and quick service, clean place !
author: Victoria A.

description: This was sadly one of the worst Chinese food we've had in SF, total bummer
author: Galina H.

description: I love this place. Food is good. Prices are decent for a good amount. Delivery is fast. What can I say keep up the great work!
author: Kevin B.

description: Great place to stop by in the Richmond for a quick and quality lunch! Left with a tab of $32 for two people and I had so much left over! Definitely recommend their combination chow mein. Overall,a great and welcoming restaurant to catch up with a friend or grab take out!
author: Jony V.

description:
I'm very surprised by the 3 1/2 star rating here. This has been my main Chinese spot for years, and not once in the many amount of times that I've ate here did I have a bad experience. No offense to the people who are saying the food is average or "gross", but you probably should check yourself to make sure your taste buds are working. The food has been delicious every single time (over 50 times) I've been here. If you seriously think this place is not good, go ahead and let me know what you think is so great, and I'll counter that, as any place has certain flaws. 

Secondly, if you are complaining about delivery time, don't order delivery. Delivery is inconsistent all the time with every restaurant and really does not validate giving a 1 star. 

The lunch specials are amazing. For an entire portion of chow mien or rice and your pick of meat. you will pay no more than 10 bucks including tip, and that's for food that is definitely above average. The environment is always very quiet in there. The food is made in literally 5 minutes if it's a quiet day, and you never have to deal with crowds, lines or anything like that.

Highly recommend this spot for lunch or dinner to anyone in the area.
author: Alex B.

description:
Not the best Chinese food you'd find but for this area, it's not bad. One of a few restaurants in the outer Richmond dist. who will deliver.  Their dishes are sometimes spot on and other times a miss. I like their garlic eggplant over rice special for $7.25 but the last time I had it the dish hardly had any garlic flavor. They give you a ridiculous amount of white rice with the eggplant, half a takeout tray full.  I can never eat the entire thing by myself.  Even half of it makes me sleep in the PM.

I used to love their Dragon beef which consists of pieces of beef fried and doused in a stick sauce.  When I tried it again a month ago, the crust of the beef was more soggy than crispy and just wasn't as good as in the past. I don't know if they changed hands or chef but the food doesn't seem as good.

I did try a bit of a colleagues curry Singapore noodles which wasn't bad.  Brown rice or fried rice is an extra charge.
author: Ry T.

description: I want to say something good but maybe I just came here on The wrong day. Super MSGd out got gut bomb. Don't think I'll be back Fried rice was JUST decent. Happy Year of the Rooster!
author: Robert B.

description:
This is my family favorite restaurant. 
We celebrate all our birthdays and anniversaries there. 
Staff is great and very friendly - they know us very well. But the food: the food is DELICIOUS!
Although, we go there too many times, I always love and enjoy their food. 

Must Have:
1. Sweet and Sour Soup
2. Chow Fun
3. Lobster Puffs
4. and Honey Walnut Shrimps
5. and the rest of their menu!

Enjoy your meal!
author: Jenna F.

description: Love this place. Always super fast delivery and always tastes fresh. Chow mein is probably one of my favorites in the city.
author: Justin S.

description: We love this place. Everything is flavorful and fresh. Dragon beef is our favorite. We have tried a bunch of different places in the neighborhood and this is the best.
author: Sabrina H.

description:
Tsing Tao has been a family favorite of my family for years, and for this cat personally it's no exception! 

This place is perfect for those who want good affordable Chinese food quick, or a nice quick dinner with family. The menu here is very extensive and everything always taste hot and fresh. 

The service here is very friendly and kind. Delivery is the only thing that has me take off one star as numerous times we've had these young guys demand more tip for delivery to us, which we give, but it's a bit annoying when they seem so annoyed at you because you gave them a tip that's apparently not good enough. Two different delivery drivers have done this to us and it's not pleasant. But besides that, everything about Tsing  Tao food is perfect, and my family and myself are very loyal customers ^ ^ 

My favorites are the mushu pork, and walnut prawns. So good! Worth also trying is the "dragon beef". Sounds odd I know but trust me it's amazing. 

Great all around go to Chinese spot! 

*chirp*!
author: Jei C.

description:
The food is really yummy but the customer service isn't. After tipping 15%, the waitress insisted that we tip her 18% and wouldn't let us leave. 
Tipping isn't a law requirement.  We could have given 0%..  
We also had two children - 2 high chairs. One child was running around, so the waitress took one of our high chairs and gave it to another customer. Then when our child was ready to sit down and eat.. Guess what?! He didn't have a high chair.. So now the 2 kids had to share one.
& you still insist we tip you 18%?!
author: Samantha K.

description: Called for a lunch special for pick up $7.50. I asked if she could give me half chow mein and half rice. No problem.... When I came to pick up the food she mentioned it was $14.00???? I asked her why so expensive she mentioned it was because of the chow mein. I asked her why you did not tell me it would cost extra, I don't mind paying but tell me next time. So I opened the box and the order for the chow mein was not even a half order it was more like a spoon. Been coming here for a while, I'll have to find a new place. Need to get their employees up to par!
author: Stan C.

description: I went here with a high school buddy of mine last week. We both got the lunch special of dragon beef with fried rice and an order of fried chicken for an appetizer. The food was yummy as usual. We notice that they forgot to bring out the hot and sour soup that usually comes with your lunch special. I asked the lady if we can get our hot and sour soup that came with our lunch special. She then told us that we have already got our soup when we never did.!She was arguing with my friend and I told my friend it's whatever if she's not trying to give it to us. About 5 mins later she came out with our soups, telling us that she must of forgotten about us.....  We don't want it anymore especially when you try to make a seen in a busy restaurant. Food was good, surprisingly that the experience was bad.
author: D H.

description:
I LOVE TSING TAO!

I walked in here with my friend on a Thursday evening and we were seated immediately. The waiter/owner recognized my friend and made some small talk before bringing us some hot tea. 
We ordered the crab cheese puff, the honey walnut prawns, sizzling beef, and rice. 
The crab puffs were bloody fantastic! It had a lot of flavor, and the sweet sauce that came with it made it even better. 

The honey walnut prawns were sooo good. The portion was generous and the prawns had so much flavor...i could taste hints of lemon and ginger. Best honey walnut prawns I've had!

The sizzling beef was good too. 

The service we recieved that evening was fantastic. The waiter came around often enough to refill tea cups and ask if we needed anything else. 

I will most certainly go back!
author: Wanda M.

description: Always good, always quick. Have not eaten in there in a while, usually just take takeout. Prices have definitely gone up though.
author: G O.

description: Best Chinese in the avenues. Quality food, no msg and nothing is greasy. Make sure to specify spice level when ordering. Seems to be dumbed down. I ordered the Kung pao chicken, wonton soup and my personal favorite, pork fried rice. Delicious and huge portions. My go-to for Chinese.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
I come here with my boyfriend because he loves the lunch special prices; it's 6.99 a plate, I believe. Each plate comes with a bowl of hot and sour soup. One time I didn't order anything and the server took the second bowl back, so don't expect a bowl unless you're ordering food. The hot and sour soup is okay, it's too sour in my opinion but at least it doesn't taste like it's out of a can. 

I've only had the Dragon Beef and the salt and pepper pork. The Dragon Beef is good and a great go-to dish, very flavorful and saucy. It also comes with broccoli. The salt and pepper pork was terrible. It had no seasoning whatsoever and the pork was way too dry. Never ordering that again. It also makes me hesitant about trying anything else on their menu, but I'm okay with Dragon Beef every time. 

Service here has been nice for each of our visits and we're always seated immediately (we usually go around 11:30am).
author: Doris K.

description: Food was pretty terrible. Don't recommend General Tsao's or sesame beef. Delivery was on time.
author: Kristina N.

description:
Looking for an inexpensive lunch in the Sunset or Richmond, my brother-in-law and I quickly realized that it was still a little too early. Most of the places were still very much closed so we drove all around to try to track an open restaurant down. We finally stumbled on Tsing Tao and walked in right as they opened so we were good to go.

I ordered the salt and pepper pork chops and he got a fried beef dish. The beef was ok if not too sweet but the pork wasn't very appetizing. In fact, I found that it was mostly fried bone and little else. I wouldn't order it again.

Overall this was a disappointing lunch experience. The food was sloppy and careless, and service wasn't that welcoming. There are much better options in the neighborhood if you wait to eat a little later though, which is exactly what I'm doing next time.

Food: 5/10

Service: 5/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 5/10
author: Joe M.

description: I usually get take out or delivery (to the SFVA). The lunch specials are great-- enough food for almost two people and tasty. Ordering online or on the phone is easy. Prices are reasonable; the best for lunch you can find. When you go there in person, the staff is super nice. Sad I am not longer at the VA to order take away from here. Parking is a bit tough on Clement at times, but if you are patient you can find it.
author: Smita D.

description: Wow, seems like people have had some bad experiences which I am surprised by.  I've ordered from here maybe 20-30 times in the last 3 years and have really liked everything I have gotten (especially the veggie fried rice).  I have never eaten in house, so I can't speak to it, but delivery and pickup have been good.  The sesame shrimp, szechuan eggplant, asparagus, and pepper tofu are my favorites but I have never gotten anything bad.  It is a little pricey compared to other Chinese food places, but it has been my go to since the first time I went.
author: Jared J.

description:
Really good , ordered at work at Chrissy field and it came fast , no delivery charge.
Tastes like I went to China :)

Ordered , sweet n sour pork, sesame chicken and chow mien . Was great
author: Jesse G.

description:
Oh, boy. This place is SO good.

The best part is, I've never actually eaten onsite. But I've had the delivery from there more times than I'd like to admit. At least 20. Probably 30. Maybe even 40.

The chicken with zucchini is the best thing in the world and the potstickers are outrageously delicious. The crab puffs are sooooo good. I even like the chow mein and rice, and I'm not usually a fan. It's always quick to be delivered, and super friendly. 

Highly recommend!
author: Jane D.

description:
This place has the best lunch specials. I always order my food for delivery and the food has great big portions, always hot and delicious when it arrives. When I call it in they say it can take 30-40 mins for delivery but, they usually arrive 15 minutes later.

My favorite lunch specials All for under $6-7:

Prawns & eggs over white rice
Prawns with bitter melon over rice
Beef with black bean sauce over rice (light sauce) Add jalapeños
Salt & Pepper pork over rice

BTW, $15 minimum for delivery.
author: Anna P.

description: Lunch specials have all been pretty good so far. I always come here for the beef chow fun. I like the salt and pepper pork chops and hot and sour soup as well. My parents always get the Szechuan shrimp.
author: Mike O.

description: We ordered delivery and the food was gross.  It had a funny smell like the oil they used to cook with was rancid and everything was overcooked with little to no flavor. I tried everything but my wife refused after smelling it.  Turns out it tasted like it smelled, GROSS! Now I have a stomach ache and $70 worth of a Friday night dinner went in the garbage.  This place is the worst! I wish I could have given it a lesser rating!
author: David G.

description:
First off, the food is okay, the service is atrocious.

I've had this place many times, but finally decided to eat there just to try it for once after having many okay take-out experiences there.

The gentleman working there is very nice and is always pleasant to talk to. A very nice person overall who is professional about his business.

Unfortunately, our waitress was the woman, who was very rude and quite hard to understand. Due to having food allergies, we had to ask about what a dish had, and quickly ordered another one instead when it did in fact have the allergen in it. All the while, she stood there gasping and grunting as if waiting those twenty seconds was the biggest burden of her life.

Throughout the night, we noticed that no one left tips, and now I can see why.

At the end of  the meal, we got a receipt written entirely in Chinese with what seemed to the the total written on it as it was the only number on the paper. I payed in cash instead of credit and even left her a tip.

Instead of a thank you, she comes back with an extra ten dollars pinned onto our bill. What was this for? Even after adding all of the food we ordered as well as the rice we were forced to buy(which we thought was complimentary given we had no choice but to get it and that it was "part of the meal", a big lie), this was a number still off by a good five dollars. Were tips included? God knows as everything was in Chinese.  We left the table clean so it couldn't have been a cleaning fee. The place was already very expensive as it was.

This was the worst waitress I had ever encountered. She deserves much less than zero stars if I could give a review on just her service.

Overall the service was atrocious, food is decent, and the tea tasted like water and smelled like soap. Would I eat here again willingly? Never. I suggest you do takeout if anything, but avoid eating in at all costs. Oh, and I got a hair in my food.

One star goes to the gentleman working there and the other to the quick service (the key word is quick).
author: Carlos R.

description: Great food. Love hit take on won ton soup. Super thick wrappers and the broth is great. Always get the mushoo for the kids. And their service is great!
author: Lisa Kim J.

description:
good ole' around the corner Chinese food! What can go wrong? ;-)
Particularly yummy hot and sour soup.
author: D L.

description: I have to honestly say that this Chinese food was really delicious. Had the lunch special and it was really good had general chicken with BBQ pork chow mein and it was filled with flavor and the chicken was tender. Will definitely come back again and the sour soup was so good.
author: Bryan P.

description:
Ok...so my boo and I were famished after walking over and back on the Golden Gate Bridge. We decided we wanted Chinese so I yelped some local spots and decided to try this little gem. To our pleasant surprise on a Sunday evening at 7pm we found parking fairly easy. I love small family owned restaurants but food can be hit or miss.

Let me tell you this was not one of the misses...they hit me in the mouth with flavor and service. We ordered orange flavored chicken, honey walnut prawns, BBQ pork fried rice and the beef and spicy garlic sauce. Every thing was perfectly cooked, all the meat was melt in your mouth tender...and best of all the staff was attentive to our every need.

I will definitely be back over and over again!
author: Andre E.

description:
I recommend the honey walnuts chicken! It's about $2-3 more expensive than their other entrées, but I would say it's worth it. The chicken is sweet (but not too sweet), the walnuts on the side add a great crunch, and together with fried rice, it will make your taste buds pretty happy. 

When I lived in the Outer Richmond, Tsing Tao was my go-to restaurant whenever I was too lazy to make dinner for myself. I would order on the phone and within 10 minutes, my meal would be ready. Having that meal ready in 10 minutes is a little sketchy because it makes you question how freshly-made the food is, but when you get as hungry as I do, you tend not to care. 

Now, I live in the Outer Sunset where there are more options for Chinese restaurants, but Tsing Tao still remains my go-to restaurant when I am craving Chinese food. It is a $20 minimum for delivery and it generally takes about 25-30 minutes for my food to get to my house. 

I would also recommend Tsing Tao for lunch. For their lunch menu, most meals cost no more than $8 and it comes with a decent portion of rice and a good portion of meat. Definitely not a bad place to grab a quick, cheap lunch. 

Overall, you can consider me a Tsing Tao regular.
author: Mark B.

description:
The spicy string beans here are amazing!
I tend to drop in and pick up just them whenever i need a quick and yummy dinner.
author: Larisa V.

description:
Went here last night with a party of ten people. Seated fast, very very polite, friendly and helpful staff. We decided to each order ONE dish each and then round robin (or lazy Susan as it were...) the rest of the evening. 

Holy deliciousness Batman, did that work out. It was a terrible battle between the ten of us' extreme hunger and the ten dishes. Despite having good portion sizes, we won and almost nothing was left on any plate. Ten dishes down the hole! I ate and I ate. Then i ate some more. It was absolutely delicious and if I'm close by in the future, I'll absolutely return.
author: Jason D.

description: Just had my food delivered less than 20 mins ago and,  i must say, their food are amazing and their gyozas are like wow.
author: Anthony B.

description:
BEST DELIVERY EXPERIENCE, EVERRRRR!!! 

It's a beautiful rainy day in SF, of course I don't want to leave home for lunch. I go onto the trusty Yelp app to see my options. 

I find this gem less than a mile down the road AND they deliver! I call and a nice man picks up, asks me to hold for literally a moment, takes my order down with ease along with my credit card info, quotes me ~$25 for two entrées and fried rice, with a 30-45 minute wait. 

I warm up my coffee and a split second later my door bells rings. Less than 20 minutes have passed, 17 minutes to be exact, and my food has arrived piping hot, fresh from the kitchen. 

I'm pretty sure my Saturday is off to a winning start!
author: Jean M.

description: Quick delivery. Sesame chicken, Dragon beef (both good sweet sauce over breaded fried meat strips) & fresh gingery pork Pot stickers. No veggies in any of those. Enough to feed 4+
author: Kalie J.

description: Really great food. We got the hot and sour soup, pork fried rice, chow mein, kung pow chicken, and orange chicken. We loved it all. Definitely coming back here for seconds! :)
author: Katie C.

description:
Eating broccoli beef and hot & sour soup on a foggy day at this place--nothing screams Richmond district of SF like this for me at least.

I have been going here since I was a lil boy, and I FRICKIN LOVE IT!

I've been in college for the past few years and every time I come back I try to make it out here to have some of this delicious authentic Chinese food cuz there's really nothing like it!

The food comes out FASSSSSST

My FAVORITES:

Broccoli beef (the standard go to entree)
Walnut prawns 
Hot and sour soup
Dragon beef
Chicken with mixed vegetables (ask for it spicy)
Chicken and broccoli
Mongolian beef


If you go for lunch its reasonable-- like $6 for a cup of hot & sour soup, rice, and a main entree. But I love this food so much I usually want to get a dinner entree and save it for later.

They also have lil COUPONS at the front of the restaurant (on the paper menus) that will give you like a free 2 liter of coke, free rice, or something similar if you buy $25 worth of food. They're only available for take out I believe.

This restaurant is family owned and the employees are all super nice and friendly. 

The restaurant itself is not extremely fancy, its a typical Chinese-decorated smaller area.

You will not be sorry if you go here. They have consistently been cooking mouth-watering Chinese food for me for almost 20 years!
author: Issa A.

description: My daughter and I ate here on our way to the Legion of Honor.  Nice, unassuming little place.  The waiter was attentive, but inobtrusive.  Food was great and big portions.  We especially liked the Tsing Tao beer.
author: Nancy B.

description: I forgotten to write a review about this place but I will never forget my awful experience! At first my husband and I loved this place. Good food, good service, awesome price. But we always ordered to go. Then one day while my husband went out for a ski trip, I had decided to take one of my friends to this restaurant because I wanted her to taste their awesome dragon beef! OMG after half way done eating it we saw a cockroach mixed in with our dragon beef! We nearly threw up in the table! I didn't want to make a seen because I saw little kids eating near us with their family. The owner said their apologies and said the food was on the house. But still!!!! My husband still misses their fried chicken and still haven't found any other restaurant in the area to compare. But knowing their secret recipe, I would never go back to this place. I hope food inspectors come and check this place out so they can clean up their kitchen.
author: lala d.

description:
Favorite Chinese delivery in the Richmond.  Eaten their food Hundreds of times, but I've never been to the restaurant.

Last time I checked though their website was incorrect, so you gotta use the phone or one of those app-order sites.  Never been disappointed.  Always delivered quickly.  Have been some mix ups in orders but never a big deal.
author: dule i.

description: The lunch special was truly that. Special :) inexpensive and great value! The portions were hearty and the waiter was friendly and courteous. The food arrived promptly, and flavor was delicious! Will definitely come again, not just for the taste but for the value.
author: Heidi Y.

description:
I came here recently with an old friend for lunch and had recieved the unexpected...an insect laying on the top of our Dragon Beef dish. Grossly enough I think the insect may have been cooked along with the dish too. We notified our server immediately, they removed the dish and gave us our entire meal for free. They were incredibly apologetic for the incident.

Although the service was very friendly and attentive from start to finish I still wouldn't come back here.
author: Cat L.

description: Americanized Chinese food (french fries are even on the menu). They seem to do a lot of take out orders. It reminds me of places my Dad used to take me in the 80's, complete with the obligatory orange wedge at the end of the meal.
author: Sam S.

description:
ordered hassle-free at eat24hours.com.

Inexpensive. Walnut shrimp + fried rice + Mongolian beef = $27 

ninja-quick delivery, arrived in 26 minutes when quoted 45-60 minutes.

Food was fresh, and not greasy.

Flavor profile was on the lower end of the spectrum, it lacks that flavor punch that 99% of all chinese restaurants have.
author: Peter T.

description:
My review is more fun than the others.  Also pretty damn informative.  Read it.  :D

First let me praise:

The Egg Foo Young -  I could eat this _every time_ an egg dish is calling to me.  Of course, breakfast would be a natural fit, but WOW... they make the best EFY.  I could eat it anytime and be just as happy.  

The chicken variety I had recently was like Chinese Soul Food.  We're talkin' tasty **chicken gravy** over three (seemed more like 4 or 5!) fresh eggs, perfectly cooked, tender and fluffeeee.  The portion was generous enough that you'll either want to split it with a buddy, or have it at home so you can stick it in the fridge and do the aforementioned breakfast thing.  I'm thinkin' WAFFLES on the side would be the ultimate brekkie I could ever have... wow..

A big 5 star stamp * * * * * from me on this dish.  I'm going to eat this everyday the next time I get a cold, which doesn't stand a chance against of Soul Food this Holy. 

Then let me get into:

Pork Buns!  Excuse me.. *BBQ* Pork Buns!  Holy ****!  I thought having grown up in SF meant I'd had the best PB's by now.  I was wrong!  You actually taste the BBQ-ness in the meat.. none of that unpalatable, slimy fat texture happenin' like what you get at most of the sidewalk dim sum joints; just sweet, tangy unadulterated Bar-Be-Que'd Pork with just the right amount of chewing resistance - not tough, not pablum, but meaty.. the way it should be.  Mine were baked and the pair of perfect brown buns made me feel for one hot second like I was on a beach in Brazil :)  I forgot to remove the semi-invisible white paper on the bottom due to being ravenously hungry.. on the first bun :)  That's ok, a little roughage never hurt anyone.  5 whole stars!  Why?  Read it again.

And finally (for this excursion):

Diced Chicken with Cashew Nuts.  Menu-described as: pan fried diced chicken with zucchini, celery and cashew nuts.  Sounds good, huh?  Welp, no celery...
about 7 cashews... lots of zucchini! (too much!).  AND, the sauce was watery.  Didn't stick to the above, which means the overall flavor was Bland unless eaten like a stew, with a big ol' spoon.  HOWEVER, once again, my peeps at Tsing Tao came through with the big ass portion.  Ok, maybe if you're hungry enough to hunt down and eat a moose, this would be one meal.  But if you eat like reg'lar folks, this could easily be your lunch and dinner.  Three-ish stars, bordering on 2.5.  Why?  Shaky prep. 

Backstory:

My folks took me here with my bro when we little tykes.  I've been in SF all my life, and it was the 1st place I had Chinese food.  Back in the day, I always seemed to end up with some combo of sizzling rice soup, mongolian beef, sweet and sour prawns or chicken, rice and 7up.  TT has been there awhile now!  The portions have increased in persons-feedable capacity, the food has been great from then to now, and I'm going back again this week.  Moving to Little Russia (about 15 blocks away from the best Chinese food at TT) was a great move.  There's a helluva lot of good food out here.   

So, by my math, 5 stars + 5 stars + 2.5 stars = 4 stars.  You can check this on your calculator, but I'm right.  They'll probably get 4.5 stars if people wise up to what's good on the menu and quit complaining about their first world problems.  We live like Royalty compared to A LOT of people in the world.  Be glad about it, then shutup and eat.
author: Jackson B.

description: Let's just get one thing straight-this is NOT the place if you want superb service and highly decorative plates-this is the place to go if you got $10 and want Chinese food-they'll be there for you. Food is good. Lunch is cheap, dinner few bucks more. Portions are big.
author: Natalya V.

description:
JUST AWFUL!  I've had TAKE OUT only because my work orders food from here now and again for different events.  
The food TASTES AWFUL:
-poor quality ingredients
-too greasy
-no flavour
With SO MANY Chinese food options, SAVE YOUR MONEY, PASS on this disgusting food.
author: CHAD C.

description:
Delivery at its best.  So obviously one of the perks of living in the city is not only good food that's opened late, but also delivery of good, well priced food of anything you want.  

I've never seen placing a delivery online for Chinese food so simplified and easy.  Everything was straightforward and the menu was easily understood without questioning if what you're ordering is what you want.  Once the order was placed, it gave an estimated time of delivery which was about 30 minutes I believe, but the food showed up before that.

You could tell that they really do make their food fresh and that the delivery was quick as the food was still way to hot to eat.  After it cooled a bit we were actually able to eat the food which was pretty good.  The hot and sour soup was exactly that.  Cream cheese and crab meat wontons were perfect.  The other food like string beans with beef were normal, not amazing, but nothing bad at all.

Will definitely be exploring more delivery options as well.
author: Zhen C.

description:
So very disappointed by my dinner here. I was craving chinese food so badly, and I had seen this place when I was shopping at Fresh N Easy across the street. I also had a coupon from EAT24 and when their site recommended Tsing Tao, it sounded great!

I got mixed veggies & tofu, chow mein and egg rolls. Very basic items. Started with the egg rolls. Took one bite and had to spit it out, it was filled with nearly raw cabbage, cold in the middle, unseasoned, it was gross. My teenage son, who will eat nearly anything, spit his out too.

Moved on to the veggies & tofu and they smelled awful like an old dish rag. Tasted exactly as they smelled, took 1 bite and was disgusted. The chow mein had the exact same smell (is it a sauce?) and taste.

I threw it all away. I wish I didn't eat the few bites that I did. Debated on whether to complain to EAT24 or not because they seem to have some awesome guarantee policy. But I decided to just never go there again and warn others!
author: Venus S.

description: Pretty much grew up going to this place. Went here for lunch today, they have lunch specials for 6.50 which include soup, large plate of food with rice, oranges for dessert and a fortune cookie. At lunch time this place is packed, but they serve your food super fast which is awesome. Food is pretty good, I had the tomato beef dish. Beef was tender so I liked it. My dad got the chicken and broccoli, he said it was decent too. I don't think there is anything in this place that is full fledged amazing, but it is all pretty good and cheap. I think this restaurant is also open most holidays including Christmas :)
author: Katherine M.

description:
Love this place.

Lunch special was really good.  Service fast and very good!
Thought that I'd try lunch after always enjoying dinner here.

I will be back.
author: Kenneth G.

description: Best Chinese in the Richmond service in restaurant and delivery service is fenomenal. I would most definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves Chinese food. My family has been eating here for years and we still love every time.
author: Gen R.

description: Good honest food, plain formica surroundings, great service.  Large portions, well cooked. You will not leave hungry.  Close to Legion of Honor.
author: Katherine R.

description:
Best chinese food I have ever had. Always non-greasy and consistently delivers on flavor.

Ii would reccommend:
-Sesame Chicken
-Chicken Chow Mein
-Pot Stickers
-Vegetable Spring Rolls

You can order delivery service from Tsing tao through Eat24.
author: Katey B.

description:
Two words: Lunch Special.  
Go to Tsing Tao before 4:00 and you'll leave full for around $6! Such a steal! 
It comes with a bowl of Hot Sour Soup and a generous portion of your entree with a heaping pile of rice.  Everything is pretty standard for Chinese Food, but I absolutely LOVE the Salt & Pepper Chicken Wings or Salt & Pepper Pork Chops.  The service is really quick and they're pretty cordial, so try this place!
author: Jessyca M.

description:
Like many people on cold rainy days, warm chinese delivery just hits the spot! I was very excited to order from this well-reviewed restaurant off of Grub Hub but was EXTREMELY disappointed. The only good thing we ordered out of the 10 things was the chow mein. But who can go wrong with that? The broccoli and green beans made us want to throw up because they tasted like they were cooked frozen and the chicken and beef dishes were not any better.

I have had some amazing chinese food in the city but I still cringe at the thought of the food here. As a college student, I am all about cheap prices but spending a little more will go a long way when compared to Tsing Tao.
author: Molly G.

description:
The food is tasty! It doesn't have that addictive flavor kick because it's MSG free!
Ordered: Hot & Sour soup, sweet and sour chicken, beef and broccoli, and BBQ pork chow mein. 

Not greasy and very tasty!

Ordered it by phone and the delivery showed up in 18 minutes.

My new favorite Chinese food place for fast delivery!
author: Lora J.

description: Heaping portions of decent asian cuisine. Lunch prices are way worth it if you're hungry enough.
author: Ruobin W.

description: Came to order their lunch special salt and pepper pork chops over rice I would say it was a bit salty and did not go well with rice and should of got something with sauce to go with rice. I would give Tsing Tao another try since the food is not that bad and it comes fast.
author: Peter C.

description: That is so good! It's awesome food for tourists! ! The price is not expensive but the food and service is really great!! I would like to recommend it! :)
author: Sabrina Y.

description:
My boyfriend told me that this was the place he used to eat at all the time when he was younger and told me the food was super amazing.. But when we walked up to the restaurant the other day, there was nobody inside so we were a little apprehensive. (This was a Saturday at around 3p.m.) Maybe it wasn't as great as he remembered? But we decided that since we were already there, then why not.

We went inside and they greeted us immediately and sat us down. My boyfriend already knew what he wanted, which was the fried rice, but since I'm not a big fried rice fan, I took awhile looking at the menu. By the time the waiter got around, I decided that I wanted the chow fun with seafood but the waiter told me they didn't have any chow fun at that time ): I settled with the chow mein instead. My boyfriend got his fried rice, and we also got an order of salt and pepper chicken wings. The fried rice came out first. I didn't realize how huge the portion was, it was more than enough for the both of us without even having to order the other dishes lol. I decided to try it since it was there and I was waiting on the other food and let me tell you, that dish changed my perspective on fried rice. I couldn't get enough of it! It was amazing. The chow mein and chicken came out after that--also huge portions--and it was pretty good too, but no lie, I could not stop going after the fried rice. 
The service was good too, the waiter checked on us often, asking if we liked the food okay, and refilled our waters when they hit the halfway mark. We got the check before we were done eating, and it was cheap. About $22 for those 3 dishes. Totally worth it! I would come back
author: Gloria N.

description:
I always order delivery and they do it very quickly. They call and say they received my order and confirm it, then they show up within 15 minutes. I live pretty close, but the food always gets here quickly and hot.

I always order the same thing: mongolian beef with seafood fried rice. The seafood fried rice is always the mark of a good place because this restaurant uses actual pieces of not stiff and chewy seafood. 

The food is delicious, the beef is a bit tough, but the flavor that I'm looking for is all there. 

If you live in Richmond, this place is the perfect place for ordering and delivery. 

I've never been to the actual restaurant, so I can't tell you about that. All I know is that they deliver really well and on time.
author: Janice H.

description: Had lunch with my pop and enjoyed the seafood soup.  The price was right and the soup was good.  The server was nice.  They even gave us a nice cup of hot and sour soup right when we sat down.  I saw a table eating a whole fish and it looked great.  Ill go back for that for sure and might upgrade my rating.
author: Johnny B.

description: This is my absolute favorite 'Chinese' place in ALL of SF. No joke. I have been coming here for about 15 years and there's a good reason for that. The food has always been fresh, not too greasy and absolutely delicious. Their lunch specials can't be beaten by price or quality and you even get free hot and sour soup if you eat in (lunch special only). Whether you eat in or get a delivery, the food is just so darn good! Totally worth the walk or drive depending on where you are coming from and always clean and comfortable inside. The staff is friendly and checks in to make sure you are enjoying your meal. They also give you free tea which I noticed many places don't anymore. I would recommend this spot to anyone in the area or not!
author: Katerina L.

description:
My review is just for the food that I ordered for delivery; I have not been to the restaurant. 

My meal was decent. Wonton soup broth was very good, but the actual wontons were so-so. The chow mein was dry (seriously, why can't any Chinese delivery place in SF get chow mein right?), the potstickers were meh. I ordered a braised bean curd entree which was pretty good, but not anything to rave about.

The delivery came quite quickly (9pm on Sat night), and the driver was friendly. I'd order from them again, but I'm still on the lookout for a good Chinese delivery in the Sunset/Parkside area.
author: Rachel T.

description: Great recommendation from Stefania at New Parish.  Long drive from Dublin, but ridiculously awesome food.  The Dragon Beef was just excellent, and would have been worth the road trip just for that.  Super friendly staff, just wish it was walking distance!
author: Michael S.

description: I've gone here for years and love the  Egg Foo Yung ...best Ive had other places are greasy but this always turns out good ....Yummy!!!! ...... Only thing I dont like the pot stickers ... dough is too thick.
author: Margaret C.

description:
Lunch specials are amazing and plentiful!  This tasty little jem of the Richmond sits across from the Lands End Trail and Golf Course. Perfect after a long hike or if you just want to order in.

I recommend the Egg Chowmein noodles (Lowmein) and the Sesame Chicken.  Dinner isn't as great of a deal money-wise but the free tea and atmosphere makes it enjoyable!
author: Martie A.

description:
Been coming here for 10 years and never been disappointed. Tasty food, great service, great value.

Best hot & sour soup I've had! I've enjoyed pretty much everything I've ever ordered. Mostly I get take out, but occasionally I'll eat in - it's never terribly crowded (although I think it should be).

If I were within walking distance I'd eat here with an unhealthy frequency.

The lunch special is a fantastic value.

Love:
Hot & sour soup
Salt & pepper pork chops
Mongolian beef
author: Bill R.

description:
If you want Chinese delivery FAST call these guys! My order was here 17 minutes after I ordered online! I have been looking for a good Chinese delivery place for the last 3 years and I have finally found my favorite!
Hot and Sour Soup was phenomenal! I am a fan.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Healthy Chinese food that's authentic?  YES, PLEASE!  There's no MSG or greasy oil spills here.  Their lunch specials are delicious, quickly prepared & cheap.  It's also nice that you're able to upgrade to brown rice, brown fried rice, etc.  

Try their Spicy Garlic Eggplant!  I hate veggies, but can eat this EVERYDAY!
author: Jennifer D.

description: This place is great!  Delivery is so fast.  I've ordered the lunch special twice so far and both times my food came within 30 minutes.  Great food, great prices, large portions.  Very satisfied customer right here.
author: Kait A.

description: Super fast delivery.  Decent, and inexpensive food.  We got hooked on their beef chow fun for a bit, and now it's on to their combination chow mein.  They serve peanut butter with their scallion pancakes - bizarre, but delicious!!
author: Jen P.

description: Wtf is this online site linking to now?  Same name restaurant in Wisconsin?  Anyone know what is going on?  I could have sworn I ordered from this site exactly last time, and yet how it's saying its in WI.
author: Eyre C.

description:
Great for take-out. Delivery is fast and well packaged for maximum heat insulation! 

Yummy Chinese food that uses REAL ingredients... everything is made from scratch and made with care. I can tell this comes from a good quality kitchen. 

This is a good place to order from if you are vegetarian. The Kung Pao Tofu was a big delicious portion of nicely cubed tofu, zucchini, and bell peppers and whole roasted peanuts in a pleasantly spicy sauce. All of the pieces were bite sized and that is a big plus in my book.

Vegetarian hot and sour soup was extremely satisfying ~ warming and flavorful ~ with plenty of bamboo shoots, pea shoots, tofu, and egg.
author: Libra J.

description:
I was craving hot & sour soup yesterday so I placed an order for some to go. I asked for less sour & more hot  and no bamboo shoots and got what I asked for. There was fungus & tofu but no meat. hmmmm

I woke up in the middle of the night choking, they had put so much msg in it that I was having problems swallowing, my mouth was dry and I was hit with the headache from hell. I have never had such a bad reaction to msg in my life. I will never order from here again.
author: May G.

description:
I love happy family and is what I order to measure if I like or not a chinese restaurant.

We ordered online because our preferred restaurant wasn't delivering, they deliver really fast  but that is not the most important thing for me, I don't smoke pot.

So the happy family was an insane mixture of things that it looked like more like a leftovers meal than a proper course. And noodles were also overcooked. Maybe I had bad luck but I'm not ordering again.
author: JL B.

description:
I ordered from here on Saturday night after coming down with the flu and needing some soup. I read the Yelp reviews and ordered from here off Grub Hub on my iPhone.
Delivery was fast and the food was hot. The hot and sour soup is amazing!!! I also ordered the pot stickers steamed and the Chicken and Broccoli. Not a fan of the way they prepare their chicken & broccoli. However, overall, I like this place. I will try it again.
author: Kellie N.

description: Okay if you like super greasy Chinese food...just overall, not good food. On the plus side, delivery was quick.
author: John H.

description: OMG!  This place is so fast!  I put in an order online for delivery and they delivered it even before I got home!  The food is average Chinese food, but I don't really expect much when I get Chinese delivery.  A good place if you want some Chinese food fast!
author: Elena N.

description:
I've never actually been here, but I order delivery from them anytime I am craving Chinese food.  To Chinese food aficionados, this place certainly doesn't qualify as gourmet or even super special...but for what it is, it's pretty fantastic!

What I love to get there:  

- Crab meat puffs (artificial crabmeat, a crab rangoon-type thing, but sooo good!!)

- Shrimp with walnuts (very tasty, not too much of the mayonaisy sauce!)

- Shrimp with lobster sauce (they don't scrimp on the shrimp!)

- Mu-shu chicken (really tasty!)

ALLERGY ALERT: If you have allergies, you simply tell them not to put something into your food, and they don't.  Anyone who has food allergies knows how hard it can be to get a restaurant to honor those types of requests, especially for delivery!

They deliver quickly, the food is inexpensive, the delivery boys are always really nice and polite (how often can you say that!), and if you order over a certain amount, you get free fried rice or chow mein...what's not to like?!
author: Amy L.

description:
This place is a quick, pleasant walk from the Legion of Honor and Land's End Trail.  It doesn't look like much, but the food is DELICIOUS and the service is so fast your head will spin.  

I love them, I love their food, and I'll totally go here again.
author: Krys B.

description:
Went here last night and must say it is among the best Chinese I have had anywhere. 

Hot and sour soup was fantastic and not too starchy like many places. 
Chicken potstickers were tender and great
Steamed whole flounder with ginger and onions was so good I asked for the recipe
Szechuan prawns were tangy and subtly spiced

Truly a great find. I shall return.
author: John D.

description:
I think we've been ordering the takeout from here for about 10 years. Lately we've been using the Tsing Tao speed dial about 1-2x a week for the last year. If we don't have their leftovers in our fridge we are ordering from them in the next day or two. 

We are really happy with their quality and taste. I think since we order from them so much we really only order the same things every time. First we have to have their crispy breaded fried white meat chicken breast with sweet lemon sauce, bbq pork chow mein is also a staple along with beef and broccoli. We are not big on the spicy stuff on the menu so can't vouch for all of that. Oh and the crispy fried wonton pork wrappers - mmm.

One thing to be said though, once I hang up from placing my order I swear they have a mobile kitchen that starts heading over. I literally got my food within 10 minutes one time, but always by 20 minutes so it's never cold and always fast. 

We'll be eating their food many more times and appreciate living so near a delicious Chinese takeout place.
author: Kira B.

description:
I came here for the first time about 20 years ago and it was mediocre.  

Now it is so much better!! I have to give them credit for improving the menu.  

I avoid a lot of salty flavors so this place really works for me. Their ingredients are fresh and the vegetables are always cooked just the way I like them - perfectly crispy - not overcooked or undercooked.   Some items are better than others, but overall I am always very happy with Tsing Tao!
author: Sue U.

description: Really good chow mein. Not greasy. Crazy fast delivery. Friendly delivery guy. BBQ spare ribs are good too.
author: Jessie H.

description:
This place is awesome and delicious.  And they deliver!
The sweet and sour chicken is my favorite, but the orange chicken is good, and another one, but I forget.  The servings are large, but don't forget to order rice...it doesn't come with the dinners, but it does come with the lunch specials!
author: Jill B.

description:
Dragon Beef, dragon beef, DRAGON BEEF!!! Yummmm!

Excellent service: prompt and friendly. 

To die for food: (see first line) Also try the orange chicken. They actually make it with orange peels! Gasp!

Skip: soda. They serve it in cans and you get free water and green tea anyway.
author: Amy B.

description: Great food and great service.  We've been ordering food for delivery from Tsing Tao for over 10 years, once every week or so, and we've never been disappointed. The order is always correct, the prices are good, and the delivery has always been on-time or early.  A nice family-owned business.
author: Chuck L.

description:
Been eating here for a couple of decades now. Another fantastic local restaurant....as far as I know, this restaurant and Pacific Cafe have basically outlived EVERY business within a 5 block radius in the Richmond. 

Delivery... I believe they stole a functional transporter from the set of Star Trek. Lunch specials... hard to beat the value. Favorites... Hot-braised chicken wings from my childhood and more recently, the shanghai style spaghetti. 

Like many of the local staples in the Richmond or any other Neighborhood for that matter. Its great if you live in the hood and don't want to travel far for a meal. If your looking for an "I'll travel the ends of the Earth to eat there" place.... Tsing Tao isn't for you. Go to one of there three other locations instead.
author: Kevin Q.

description:
Nothing fancy, but I still have fond memories of high school when my friends and I would drive here during lunch to each get a box of beef chow mein to go.  Those were the days.

Anyway, was in the area feeling nostalgic and needed a quick lunch (didn't feel like fast food) so I popped in and ordered some beef chow mein to go.  Was surprised to see it come in a large, flat environmentally correct container.  A big difference from the traditional asian take-out boxes from the olden days (which still exist elsewhere).  The chow mein was hot and good, although a little bland.  Some soy sauce kicked it up a notch and the generous portion was more than enough.

Noticed they have some really inexpensive lunch specials...will have to come back and try some of their other offerings sometime.
author: Roy N.

description:
The funny thing is, I just realized that I recently ordered from the Fillmore location of Tsing Tao which has lower ratings but tasted way better!

My roommate and I ordered online from Tsing Tao over the weekend. I was happy that it arrived in 40 minutes when the site said an hour. Unfortunately, we realized that part of our order was wrong (ordered and paid for beef and mushrooms, got chicken) and it just wasn't very good. The sizzling rice soup was plain and had chunks of ham which weren't listed in the description. The hot appetizer plate was entirely deep fried so I wouldn't recommend it. The chow mein was decent though.

But overall, wouldn't try it again and wouldn't recommend it.
author: Emilia S.

description:
Living in the Presidio, some nights you just need something that'll be delivered right to your door. 

Ordered delivery from this place for the first time. Promp service, about 35 min delivery time. 

Ordered sushi Rainbow row (CA roll + salmon on top), spicy tuna roll, and an edamame for 16.75 total at my doorstep with tip= 20 bucks. 

Portions were big and flavor freshness was really great for the money. i.e. much better than airport sushi but a slight step below the best sushi you've had. (at probably 30 dollars more). 

They also have Chinese food and there is no charge for delivery.
author: Legal C.

description:
I want to love this place, but my bf has gotten sick from this 2 times (we gave it a second chance, probably shouldn't have)
other than that, they're deals are pretty good & they deliver so that's a plus I guess
2 stars friends...
author: K M.

description:
I've been eating here for the entire 22 years that I've been on this planet. Or, as long as I've been able to eat solid food, at least. Some of my earliest memories of food involve Tsing Tao. So it's pretty close to my heart, to say the least. I'm not even sure I can express just how much I love this place.

When I was young, my parents would order barbecue pork fried rice, barbecue pork chow mein, and chili pepper prawns (the sauce always comes on the side, so I would just eat the fried shrimp, they were my favorite food). I've since become more adventurous and tried numerous things on the menu, almost all of them equally delicious. But occasionally I feel like eating like I'm 4 again, and I order my chow mein/fried rice/shrimp combo of love. It never disappoints, and it brings me back to my childhood something fierce.

On top of the food that I can't get enough of, the delivery speed is insane. There have been times that the food has shown up in 10 minutes or less. There was ONCE that I recall it taking the full 45 minutes they claimed. This has really ruined me for all other delivery; all other places I've ever ordered from feel like they take FOREVER.

They're also extremely accommodating. My mother is ridiculously picky, and even though I've convinced her to give other menu items a try, she insists on ordering them HER WAY. The staff is very good about taking her needlessly complicated orders and filling them (correctly!) without complaint. And for the rare time that they do get something wrong, they're quick to do what they can to correct it.

And for the people who complain about the large portions, since when is more for your money ever a bad thing? They pack those little red and white boxes almost beyond capacity every time, which means that not only do I have dinner that night, but lunch tomorrow. They definitely do not skimp on anything.

That being said, I've had a grand total of two less than awesome experiences here. Once, my beloved chili pepper prawns were burned beyond being edible. But they gave me a new order, so I can't really complain. The second time, I ordered the lemon chicken which I regretted. It was too saccharinely sweet, the lemon sauce tasted more like it should have been drizzled over vanilla ice cream instead of served on the side of fried chicken.

Overall though, this will always be the Chinese restaurant that my heart belongs to. I don't know what I'd ever do if they closed their doors.
author: Chelsea T.

description:
I go to that place at least 3 times a week for lunch. They are cheap, fast and very friendly. 6$ lunch special is unbeatable.
Go and try!
author: Carlo M.

description:
Please don't hate me for telling you this!!!

They have the BEST chocolate ice cream. Be warned, it's very addictive! 

It arrives in literally moments, ice cold, along with excellent hot food. I love this place!
author: Sharon J.

description:
I ordered this tonight. The weather is lousy and I have a nasty cold. I read some of the reviews and was almost put off but thought I would give them a shot.
Delivery within 45 mins, the food was piping hot and it all tasted delicious. I will order with Tsing Tao again.
author: Shane W.

description: Had the won ton soup and the wonton was mostly skin and no meat.  I also got food poisoning and was in the bathroom all night.
author: Frances L.

description: My favorite Chinese food in the outer Richmond. I'm all about value and quickness and this place provides both.
author: Chancelor D.

description: First off I'd like to say that they are sure fast when delivering your food.  I appreciate that!  Their food isn't the worst by no means but everything was way too salty for me.  I don't know if it was the MSG but after eating a small serving, I made myself a big ole salad!  We ordered the chicken fried rice, egg foo yong, and scrambled egg over beef.
author: Christy A.

description: Our go-to Chinese takeout. Always quick, friendly, and great food. Not super traditional, which is why I love it. Definitely the type of Chinese I grew up with. Love the string bean and pork and the chicken chow mein.
author: Danielle C.

description:
I think I just found my go-to Chinese take-out joint!

I was recommended by my roommate to try this place and ordered delivery via eat24hours.com. The website said delivery time was about 45-60 minutes; I live about 10 minutes away and retrieved my order in the estimated range of time, maybe even less. 

I ordered the Dragon Beef and Chicken Chow Mein. With a vitamin water and tip, it was only about $18! That in itself is pretty cheap, not to mention that the serving size is HUGE. They literally stacked the chow mein to the very rim of the take-out box! The beef and chow mein could easily feed 2-3 people. The Dragon Beef was perfectly spicy and wasn't overly covered in sauce, and the chow mein was delicious and not greasy at all. Definitely no need to add any extra soy sauce.

I will surely order here again :)
author: Ronald T.

description:
Be prepared to walk into a huge 3 course meal for only $6 and some change. This restaurant is located in a good neighborhood and the decor is fresh. Most cheap Chinese restaurants will look a bit run down while this one actually looks pretty good. As soon as you sit down they will offer you free hot tea and iced water on request. The table settings are all placed in advance but they will take them away once you order since their happy hour is served in individual portions rather than family style. The first course is a bowl of their soup of the day. Unlike many other Chinese restaurants, their soup of the day doesn't taste overly salty or drenched in MSG. (MonoSodium Glutamate) The entrees here are humungous. It looks like the plates were meant for two people. At the end, they bring out a few slices of orange and some fortune cookies for dessert.

We ordered six plates on our visit there. I tried a piece of every plate so I can share my experiences here. The Dragon Beef and Dragon Chicken stood out the most. They were pieces of fried meat with sweet and sour sauce that was more on the sweet side which gave it the perfect taste. Each piece was nice and crunchy but not hard at all. The Dragon Chicken and Beef were soft on the inside. There were no vegetables on this plate, it was for pure carnivores. One of us ordered the Beef and Broccoli plate and the meat was very tender. The broccoli didn't taste flavorless at all and the beef was not over powering. The meat was from a mediocre cut but was somehow as soft as the Steak Cubes from a higher end restaurant like Koi Palace. The shrimp was horrible, avoid ordering that from the happy hour menu. They were hard and oily. For under $6 you can't really expect really good seafood anywhere in San Francisco anyways so that was somewhat expected. Another plate we ordered was the Beef Chow Fun. The Beef Chow Fun was not  on the happy hour menu but we ordered it anyways. There isn't much skill required to make a plate of noodles so it came out exactly as we expected, there was nothing extraordinary about it. Overall, most of the dishes that were served for happy hour are highly recommended, just stay away from the shrimp.

The service during happy hours was excellent. Generally, cheaper Chinese restaurants would ignore customers as they come in and seat them at an uncleaned table. Then they would rush the order out of the customers and slap the entrees carelessly on the table. Before people are even done eating, they will serve the bill and give out a "you need to go" vibe. Tsing Tao was the opposite of my stereotype of a cheap Chinese restaurant. We didn't feel rushed at all and they waiter was smiling as he spoke to us. Our entrees came out relatively close so no one needed to watch others eat while they wait. The bill did not come until we asked for it and we were not rushed to leave. It was relatively slow during happy hour which may explain the better service we were getting compared to the usual experience in a Chinese restaurant but that just means we paid less for more service.

Source&Photos: http://damonfong.wordpress.com/2012/09/12/tsing-tao/
author: Damon F.

description:
I love the food here.  It's not world class, but it is consistent and quality.  It always tastes great, take out or dine in, I love it.  It is my go-to spot for Chinese food.  I used to work next to the location in the outer richmond and ate there almost everyday.  Then, when I worked in Potrero Hill, my office would order take out from the one in the mission and the quality between both places was consistent.  

Love love love chicken with mixed vegetables, fresh, hearty veggies.  And if I'm splurging, the lemon chicken is out of this world sweet and tart.   This is a great place for a good price.
author: Amy J.

description: EW...i just ordered delivery...the chow mein was probably made a week ago...gross!
author: Irina M.

description: Food was good.  It was oddly quiet, alittle background music would have helped.  But I'd be down to eat here again. I had General Tao's Chicken with House Fried Rice, and Wontons. All standard good. The waiter was very attentive to keeping our water's filled, which means alot to me. And my guest seemed to like his Sesame Chicken and Spring Rolls.
author: Trevor N.

description:
I'm glad there are some people on here who share my hate for this place. If I could give NEGATIVE stars, I would!

We went here for lunch, and I was surprised that we got the Hot & Sour soup for free with water, but that's because it was HORRIFIC. I smelled it and knew I wasn't gonna be able to eat any of it. They need to learn how to make their soup from Abacus on Hayes street, now that's real soup!

Also the sesame beef was nasty. They fried all the fat! Half of the plate was white and none of it was crispy.

The chow main was okay, a little too greasy for my taste though.

The inside also isn't very pleasant. Smelled like they clean the tables with a 3 year old smelly towel and the plastic cups have got to go. 

Never coming back again.
author: Bella S.

description:
I cannot give 5 stars to this place, even though I love their food.  Here are a few reasons why:

1)  Be warned:  Their bathroom floors are so f-ing slippery!  I swear to you to use caution when going in and out.  I'd be shocked if they didn't have many complaints on this.

2)  Like nearly all Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, they have a $10 minimum for credit card purchases.

3)  Like nearly all Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, their waiters, waitresses, and delivery people don't keep their tips.  I saw this one guy in there doing a pick-up order.  He didn't have to tip, but he did, and the waitress just put the tip money in the register without a 2nd thought.

4)  Like nearly all Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, they round up your total to the nearest whole cent total.  There are no $10.37 purchases; they'll round up to $10.40.  There are no $27.98 purchases; they'll round up to $28.00.

Their food is really good.  I strongly recommend their soups (hot n sour and seaweed, especially), any eggplant dish, and their appetizers.  They also have decent egg foo young, something that is hard to find in the city.  Their kung pao dishes are good, too.  They have kung pao shrimp, chicken, tofu, and beef.

They have lunch specials until about 5:00 pm.  They also do online orders, but for some reason, that is set so your minimum purchase needs to be $15, where if you call, it's only $10.

Super-fast delivery!

They have brown rice.

Parking isn't bad.

Restaurant isn't pretty but not the worst I've been in.

They're open until 10:00 pm.
author: Dicky V.

description: Great non-greasy food here and surprising affordable lunch special. They make a fantastic "lemon chicken", "kung pao tofu" and "sauteed spinach with garlic". They have no problem substituting white meat for me in the Almond Chicken, which is my fav here. Definitely worth it.
author: Cherie F.

description: I have been ordering food from this restaurant for over 5 years!  We have always been satisfied with the service and quality of the food.  Today I have changed my mind.  The fried wonton were wrapped in a thick membrane that did not allow them to get crispy but just soggy and greasy!  The pot stickers however, were loosely wrapped in thin membranes and hardly sticky and they were supposed to be pork filled but the filling was dark and not tasty like pork.  The honey walnut prawns came with sticky imitation nuts!  HORRIBLE!!!!  I am sooooooooooooo disappointed.  Never again.  sorry.  They just lost a regular.
author: Emilia G.

description:
not one dish we ordered had ANY flavor. i can't imagine how every dish could taste as bland as it did. i kept trying to like it, but just couldn't. even the soy sauce packets (not the typical ones you see at most chinese take out) had any flavor!! the menu said the beef with eggplant was spicy, but it was less than mild. SO SO disappointing. definitely will not be ordering from them again. 

really fast delivery and food was hot. the only two pros :-( but so not worth ordering from them again.
author: Miss T.

description:
Ben and I live around the area, but it took us a long time to go and try this place. Everytime we walked by, the place is usually empty or with a few people dining in. We were hesitant, but decided to give it a try one night.  Don't let that empty place fool you, their food is delicious and plentiful. You'll definitely get your money's worth here.

We've been back there a few times since our first visit and enjoyed our meal every time! We found out they do most of their evening business on take-out, which explains the empty store front. We usually stick with the usual simple dishes. Ben loves their general tao's chicken and their mu-shu pork. We had tried on different occasions their hot and sour soup, wonton soup,  mongolian beef and spicy garlic eggplant .

Like many chinese restaurants, I found the dishes to be a little on the salty side, although Ben disagrees (he loves salt). I find myself drinking lots of water later. Nevertheless, the food tastes great and they come in big portions and it's not too expensive. We always end up with leftovers to bring home.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Let me just start off by saying their hot and sour soup is like crack! Keeps you comin back!!! Ive been going here since freshman year of HS for their affordable and delicious lunch specials and even now over 10 years later I keep comin back for lunch and dinner. Whether its to go or eat in their food is always fresh and hot and most of all delicious. Its a clean establishment the staff is mostly friendly and their prices are cheap!!! 

For lunch you get your choice of meat/seafood over rice or chow mein with a small bowl of hot and sour soup... add drinks and you are still under $20 for 2 people.

For dinner you can order seperate dishes a la carte. Ate here the other day with 3 others for dinner and it only cost us around 60 dollars! 

P.S. f you have left overs they are still very good the next day!
author: Anthony M.

description: VERY nice delivery guy BUT WORST Chinese food I've EVER had.  BOTH dishes (walnut prawns and lemon chicken) were absolutely disgusting, portion was ridiculous (especially on the walnut prawns!) and it was extremely disappointing!  I was attempting to try a different Chinese delivery and it was an epic fail!  Considering the raving reviews, I apparently caught them on a REALLY bad night for delivery or in general.  I will NEVER order from them again because I don't feel they could re-do that disaster!  I spent $22 on two dishes that were a major loss!
author: Maddy B.

description: I will never order from them again.  I waited over TWO hours for them to deliver my food and never got it.  At about an hour and a half into the wait, I called to check and they lied and said it was with the driver and on the way.  LIE. Called back two + hours in and they said they forgot to make the order.  They offered (after being prompted) $10 off. Lol. Right. I wouldn't trust them to make my food after this. I hate liars.  Just admit up front the first time that you failed.  That way I could've made other plans in a timely manner!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Fast delivery and good chinese food. Not too greasy and simple tastes that'll satisfy any hunger for chinese food. Their lunch specials are cheap too, for a lot of food (my favorite is curry chicken)! I order from them a lot for their value. Lots of food for less money. Their soups are great too- I like the seaweed with pork one. :]

All in all: Not amazing chinese food mind you, you get what you pay for. And this is GREAT for what you pay for.
author: Julie M.

description:
these guys are amazing!
