they are great at accommodating and they deliver speedily!
the food is delicious too! my favorites are their hot and sour soup and chow mein!!
author: Sammi H.

description:
Allows you to order their super cheap lunch deals for takeout. Gives you more chicken and broccoli than other places will give you for dinner. Complements with enough rice to feed someone in need down the street. Adheres to requests for light on the oil (unless that's how they always do things).

Summation: Better than most.
author: Jason B.

description:
Worst restaurant ever.  This is going to have to be renamed Tsing Toilet because that's exactly where my meal ended up.

Ordered delivery from here about a month ago and the violent food poisioning that ensued will assure that I never eat anything from Tsing Toilet again.  

Hot & Sour Soup was not very hot or sour, it tasted more like beef broth.
The Snow Pea Prawns were the culprit for the illness.  This dish didn't even taste very good going down so you can imagine the reverse order.
General's Chicken- rubbery and gross.

Save your money and order from Hunan Cafe #2!
author: Alicia G.

description: Went to TT last week for lunch. the place is very nice, and spacious. parking not a problem. The lunch meal is $5.10 a rice plate , there is    chow mein for a little more $6.00ish. they also offer take out and this is 1 out 4 restaurants.
author: Howard J.

description:
tsing tao is my go to for delicious delivery chinese on those nights i just want to lounge in my pajamas, watch bad tv, and not cook.  i've tried quite a few delivery chinese places and this one is pretty awesome. plus, they have dim sum. delivery dim sum is something dreams are made of! and it's actually pretty good.

their veggies are fresh which i appreciate. no msg. and they get it to you in a crazy quick fashion. i swear they cook it on the way over. 

my faves so far are the dragon beef and shrimp dumplings.
author: Becky B.

description: Good food, good service, cheap prices (specially for lunch combos). We tried 4 different combos and they were delicious. Chicken mandarin was the best!
author: Fabricio B.

description:
Our friends took us here on a saturday night before they're 10pm closing.  They're really friendly unlike most chinese restaurant wherein customers are more like annoyance to their business.  

The food was awesome and the prices are very inexpensive circa late 1990's pricing structure.  i felt like I was back in college with their lunch menu prices.
author: Erby V.

description:
When I ordered in Chinese one day, the waiter literally jumped back and stared at me, and asked (in complete surprise), "WHA?? YOU SPEAK CHINESE?!"

Yes.

Anyway, they're super nice.  8 of us were there past closing, and they didn't once rush us.  Instead, they asked if we wanted more water and apologized for the kitchen being closed (3 of us went in before it closed, the rest of them joined us later).

The food is good, and is reasonably priced for Chinese food at a sit-down restaurant.  It's not the best food, but hey, it's a block from my house and they have great service.  There's sometimes nothing I look forward to more than picking up their take-out and curling up at home on the couch with The Office.
author: Tori S.

description: Love this place .... we been coming here for years..... I mean for over 18 years.... my family loves that place .... same owners now the old man is in back cooking and his son running the show but still really really good place and dear to my heart........ My grandfather use to love this place we would come for all his bday partys here only he really loved that place........ Keep up a good job and we will see you soon again........
author: Boris M.

description:
I live less than a block away from Tsing Tao and when I was still going to high school, my friend and I would eat here during our lunch or before golf practice after school. The staff are accommodating, they bring a very local feel to the experience. Even today, 5 years from the first time, the service I remember very well remains strong, if not stronger (not to mention a newly remodeled interior).

There are a couple dishes I recommend:
1.Dragon beef, pork, chicken (whichever speaks to you) and Hot braised chicken 

Ok, if you haven't figured out already I am a biased meat-eater. But before you judge, I love my vegetables too!

I've never had a problem with the atmosphere. So if you're looking for a simple afternoon or evening meal without the hassle of waiting or planning, you can't go wrong with Tsing Tao.
author: Jason N.

description: good food. been coming to this place since high school, their Hot and Sour soup is the best!
author: Anthony P.

description:
i order here quite often. sometimes i get my food a little too quick which scares me. However the food is always edible which is a plus, considering some of the food i have ordered from the area. 
Mongolian Beef is always spicy which i enjoy

rice is a little expensive if you ask me.  but i am lazy enough to order it time and again
author: Trent D.

description:
We'd have urge for Tsing Tao food every once in a while. I wouldn't say that their food is the best, but they're super fast, that's for sure! The price is fair, lots of vegetables as well as good meat. I'd recommend this place to anyone. I'd also go back there soon. 

PS

They brought 2 fried rice by mistake instead of Chow-Fan. When I called them, they came back right away and gave us the right order. However, they brought one fried-rice back. It is 100% fine with me. I just hope they throw that food away...  The food was out of their sight more than 10 minutes. Who knows what people might have done with it... You know?
author: Y T.

description:
I haven't been here in a while and suggested it last Sunday when my friends and I were in the mood for chinese. The parking could have been easy if this guy didn't take up 2 freakin parking spots. I mean my friend rolled down the window and said "Can you move either way, so we can park, please" Freaking Hilarious.
Anyways, the prices were great and you can get a lunch special for $4.55, how awesomeis that!
There were five of us so we ordered:
Small Hot and Sour Soup
Small Wonton Soup
Mongolian Beef
Sweet and Sour Pork
Chicken Chowmein
Squid 
Rice

They were all very good and some of the best chinese food I've had in a while. My friends and I were pretty loud too and they didn't seem to mind. ( we were a bit hungover). So that's a plus for me.
Once thanksgiving is done, I'm goin back. :)
author: Lana K.

description:
Ehhh.....I used to love this place.  They would make the BEST combination chow mein.  Anywhere.  Now, it's oh-so-ordinary and bland.  I went here with my family and ordered what I thought were Spring Rolls.  Inedible.  This from a guy who eats anything.

The dragon dishes are still okay, but just okay.  But overall, the place is way way too inconsistent.  There are much better places further down on Clement.
author: Marlin B.

description:
When I think of soy sauce and Chinese food, I immediately think of that scene from The Joy Luck Club where Waverly took her fiancé to her parents house for dinner for the first time and poured soy sauce all over her mom's most special dish of the evening because she claimed it was "no good" which was a cue for the family to praise the dish as it was the best they've ever tasted. The look of horror on everyone's faces (minus clueless fiancé) was priceless!

Anyway, that's what I thought of when I receieved my online delivery order which included 2 packets of soy sauce. 

I normally don't add soy sauce to my food unless I have dim sum (and then I'd just mix it with chili sauce) but I needed to because the hot and sour soup (don't laugh! I don't laugh at you for ordering orange or lemon chicken!) was incredibly bland. The deep fried chicken (boneless) appetizer was bland, dry and rubbery. Now I know I don't really have high standards when it comes to hangover food (I honestly just want something in my stomach to digest) but this was horrible. It could make Panda Express just as good as Yank Sing. The only saving grace was this beef in garlic sauce dish because at least  it registered on the taste radar and the fact that it didn't take that long for delivery. 

But despite this experience, I did enjoy the fact that in their take out menu (included in our order), they listed their sauteed spinach dish as "Sauteed Spanish". 

Olé!
author: kristin e.

description: I can't really recommend this place for lunch Monday through Friday, while the school year is in session. It can get overrun with tables of screaming  kids, which makes the noise level deafening, and is WAY worse than having surfing buddies who DO NOT tell tell you that you have big 'ol swim boogers hanging from your nose  ;0))
author: Richard T.

description:
Onion city.  

And I hate onions.  

Parking sucks too.  

Stay away, unless you live to eat onions in every f!cking dish you order!  Gee, I have an idea for you:  order some liver too.
author: Bevy M.

description:
meat egg rolls are amazing!!!
mongolian beef and chowfun are bombbbb
author: Mar L.

description: I literally got my food ten minutes after ordering it was insane. Its really good not too greasy but the portions could be smaller and Helloooo why dont the entrees come w rice???
author: Rachel K.

description:
Consistently good and crazy fast.  I'm not going to sit here and claim that they are the best but they're a great option in the Outer Richmond.

We order from here at least twice a month.  We live on 34th, between Geary and Clement.  They are on Clement, between 32nd and 33rd.  The first time we ordered delivery, they asked for our cross streets.  She asked, "Are you sure?"  Yes, we were sure.  They delivered and never questioned again how lazy we are!  I appreciate those who respect my position of Couch Queen!!!

Today, for the very first time, I volunteered to go pick it up.  I needed to get out of the apartment.  They took the order over the phone but no name or phone number-- I just figured that we were the only takeout so they'd be able to figure it out easily.  I arrived and looked a little lost because I didn't know if I should wait at the front or go to the back to pick up.  The girl came to me and was sweet as could be.  I apologized and told her we order all the time but that I'd never picked up.

She said, "I know."  I scratched my head a bit.  And then I realized--I am probably the only freak on the planet that orders plain chow mein.  

Oh well.  The inside of the place looks clean, the staff seems friendly.  If I ever decide to wear something other than pajamas on weekends, we might stroll down for lunch.

Until then, I love the delivery guys!
author: Melissa Q.

description:
I went here a few times during high school and have also ordered out recently several times as well. All in all, the food was good--I mostly chose it because they delivered, and, well, I'm lazy.

However, last time my food had a hair in it. And not the kind that grows on your head. Needless to say, I'm done with this place. There are plenty of Chinese restaurants that will take enough care not to let their pubes fall where they may.

That's what I get from ordering from a place that was too cheap to pay for their advertising. If they go back on paying for a service with no legitimate reason, then they clearly have no qualms about cutting corners in other areas too. 

And just cause the place has been around for a while, doesn't mean it's quality. You know what else refuses to die? Cockroaches.
author: Tatiana T.

description: Very good Shanghainese food. Had the Dragon chicken, which had a nice combination of sweet, sour, and spicy flavors. Surroundings are clean and service is ok.
author: Buck N.

description:
Holy  F!  These guys are the fastest delivery in San Francisco.  I imagine that when the order is ready in the Kitchen.  The head chef says to the driver.  " Go my son,  Go with the f...ing wind "  And the driver is away, peeling rubber up the street.   Kung Pau and General Sou was the order of the day.  I do feel the food is pretty bloody good.   I don't know what the naysayers are about.
Speaking of Kung Pau , you should watch the movie Kung Pow while eating General Sou's.  Hey my play on words.  Bugger you if you feel you need to get my english correct , I am eating chinese.
Ciao for now.

Nick
www.lostcampersusa.com
author: Nick T.

description:
It is still a mystery to me how this place delivers the food so quickly! I mean: shouldn't it take at least more than 20 minutes to cook the food, put it in a to-go container, bag it all up, give it to the delivery person, walk to the car, open the car door, get into the car, start the engine, and drive? Makes me wonder how fresh their ingredients are... The food isn't bad at all, but it's not great either :-)!

It's pretty convenient to order take-out or pick up food from here if you want it super-duper fast! Plus they advertise NO MSG and the prices are reasonable and affordable.
author: Celeste M.

description:
Star 1- This place is 1/2 a block away from my new apartment.
Star 2- LUNCH SPECIAL. $4.55 to $5 for soup, rice, entree, orange, and fortune cookie. AND they serve "lunch" until 5pm. 
Star 3- AMOUNT of food. Seriously... they pile your plate FULL of rice and your entree. I always eat half my plate, at most. 
Star 4- Taste. It's pretty good! Better than the local Chinese food back in my old neighborhood. 
Star 5- Speed. They are SO quick, and the food is always piping hot so I know they make it fresh.

How could this place NOT be 5 stars? No, it's not the BEST Chinese food I've ever had, but the location and value, combined with everything else... Let's just say that Tsing Tao and I will be good friends when the school year starts up again!
author: Bridgette A.

description: Dragon Beef is good, as is their Singapore Rice Noodles and eggplant.  Lunch special pricing is really nice and cheap.  This place is great for take-out for lunch and/or dinner..but it's definitely not my favorite Chinese food place in the Richmond District.  There's just so many other choices around.  Still, food is pretty good here.
author: Loren L.

description:
Tsing Tao is our regular Chinese delivery place, not least of which because they are so fast it's almost eerie.  Our current theory is they use some kind of time machine to go back and begin cooking your food before you actually order.  It's nice when we spend all evening going, "I dunno, what do you want for dinner?" only to discover it's 9:00.  

And the food?  Totally solid, reasonably priced, not too greasy, and it avoids the "every dish drenched in generic brown sauce" syndrome.  Despite our repeated requests, the food is rarely as spicy as we'd like, but we are a little nuts that way, so I hardly blame them.  

Some of our regular dishes:
Crab Meat Puffs
Kung Pao Chicken
Shredded Beef with Chili Sauce (this is particularly tasty)
String Beans with Chili Sauce
Vegetable Chow Mein
Spicy Sesame Prawns
author: Martha S.

description:
I've been to Tsing Tao countless times since first discovering it almost exactly a year ago, and that should speak for itself.

Admittedly, I've never tried their delivery; call me old-fashioned, but I prefer to sit face to face with a server and experience a dish exactly as they intended: flatware, dishes, condiments, other patrons, etc.

Regardless, their in-house dining has always been a quick turnaround from order to eating, the serving staff polite and attentive, and of course the food itself prepared to be very edible; I have yet to try something that I wouldn't order a second or third time. But at this rate, I might as well finish my routine sampling of everything on the menu one at a time.

The prices are quite affordable, especially the outstanding lunch specials. A giant meal of an entree, rice, soup, and fruit typically runs me only 4.55, which they serve (dining room) until 5pm, as opposed to the 3pm listed on their website, which is their cut off for lunch delivery. Many of their dinner items are highly affordable just the same. A simple but filling dinner for two can be had for less than twenty dollars, easily.

It's not the fanciest joint in the world, and perhaps not the most gourmet food, but it IS delicious and one of those hidden neighbourhood gems that everyone loves stumbling upon.
author: Aaron H.

description: I like this place only for their fried crab cheese puffs which are pretty good.  I don't care for their chow mein, it comes with too many green onions and bean sprouts.  It made the chow mein taste weird.  I'm not impressed with their other items either and so far I only order what I know I like and that's the crab cheese puffs.  We've ordered a couple of large aluminum pans worth for parties and our guests like them, they make a great appetizer and you get a lot of that sweet and sour sauce for dipping.  Their delivery is super fast and we love it that the delivery person smiles when he gets a tip.
author: Emy B.

description:
Best damn Kung Pao I've had in the city.  Sure there might be better out there, and the best I ever had was in Beijing at DaYaLi, but this place is great everytime.  They deliver it quickly and it's always hot, fresh, and delicious.

Haven't tried much else on their menu but I have tried many other Kung Pao's in the city that SUCK.
author: James G.

description: Very tasty food and super fast delivery. I ordered using GrubHub and my food was delivered in 15 minutes. Amazing!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
The dragon beef was MEH. I was not expecting it to be breaded so maybe that's my fault for not reading the menu carefully. If you order it, definitely get a couple other items as you will get sick of eating the beef QUICKLY.... You get a whole box of that beef that could feed an entire country. I ended up throwing away the leftovers after a week of not eating it again. I also ordered the crab rangoons which were really oily - also too much breading and too little imitation crab.

I have had much better and only came here out of desperation of starving myself! Contrary to belief, this place was not cheap and I probably spent almost $20.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I order half a roasted duck here all the time (I think I'm subconsciously trying to give myself a heart attack @___@ ) and a cup of soup. As a college student who's still dealing with school, work, and living off campus, I love this place when I want to take a break from cooking dinner at home. I usually have left overs for the next two days and I can bring the duck for lunch at school! 
Sometimes I'll throw my left overs in with the rice I'm about to cook and just let it cook with the rice. OOoooOOoo mah gawd, so good! 
The only thing I don't like is that when I order the usually Chinese dishes that I like (in general) from here, it tastes off from all the other places....Oh well, I love their duck :3 and their soup. That's all that matters.
author: Allie W.

description:
I have been ordering from Tsing Tao's for years and loved them however, the last 2 deliveries over the last 3 months have been a disappointment. The food such as the shrimp dumplings, do not taste fresh and the chicken in the General's Chicken and Lemon Chicken is stringy and dry. 

On the positive side, their hot and sour soup is amazing as is their Mongolian Beef. Delivery is fast and hot. 

Unfortunately, with other options around, I will take my business elsewhere as $75.00 in Chinese food is a lot to throw away.
author: Sheli F.

description:
I ordered by delivery the medium appetizer platter ($10.00) and the szechuan dumplings ($5.00) for dinner, it was more than enough food for two people and we had leftovers. 
The appetizers were all deep fried: 4 egg rolls (listed as spring rolls), 3 crab cheese puffs (there are onions inside), 4 chicken wings and 2 drumsticks, all of which had very little meat on them, and 6 little shrimp (listed as prawns). 
The dumplings weren't in a szechuan sauce, but instead were doused in some sort of pork grease and sweet tasting substance...
On the plus side, on line ordering was very convenient and the delivery was fast. Even though I could have easily walked a few blocks to get it myself. (The Chinese New Year parade was on and I didn't want to miss anything!) 

I'm not going to judge this restaurant based on it's fried appetizers, so I will definitely be updating this review after the next time I eat there. A lot of the dishes on their menu look like they are worth trying.
author: Chelsea H.

description:
I love this place. They have the fastest delivery and they will make anything you ask! If you want chicken added to something, they will do it, add some tofu add some heat, they will do it. 

I first started ordering from here after a huge night out and of course looking for a hangover remedy.. their hot and sour soup is amazing and the portion is huge a medium can serve 4 people, i love their veggie spring rolls and their sweet and sour shrimp are tasty delights!  I always get the vegie delight but their noodles are great too.
author: liz t.

description: When you spend a day with your boyfriend watching Donnie Yen fight scenes on YouTube, you realize what a strong urge you have to eat some fried rice and orange chicken. Thankfully, Tsing Tao is our go-to Chinese food place and it doesn't disappoint. Will this help you to train like Ip Man? Will it give you the Fists of Fury you're looking for? Will you be ready to Enter the Dragon? No. But it's a great compliment to watching Chinese martial arts movies on a lazy Saturday.
author: Sasha S.

description: Fast Delivery! YUMMY Hot and Sour Soup! and GrubHub.com ordering? Best Chinese in Richmond.
author: Jasmine A.

description: What a nice neighborhood find.  Was on our way to the Legion of Honor and needed a bite to eat.  Had a delicious bowl of wonton soup and some chow fun.  $11 dollars for lunch for two . . . am I really in San Francisco?!
author: Janet S.

description:
Order for delivery today and was delightfully pleased.  My co-worker and I ordered two luncheon specials:  Scrambled Egg with Prawns, Hot Plate Combo appetizer, and Westlake Beef Soup.  It was dee-lish!  The prawns were substantial and plentiful and the scrambled eggs were just that...scrambled.  (Often times I have ordered this elswhere and got a more gravy like consistency--which is fine, but not really what I was expecting).  The appetizers were still hot and YUMMY.  The spring rolls were bursting with veggies and the crab puffs were full of cream cheesy goodness.

I would definitely order from them again especially since I have been on a quest to search for good delivery (while at work on the weekends and am too lazy to walk to Laurel Village during my quick 30 minute lunch.)
author: Row M.

description:
I have been ordering from Tsing Tao for the last 5 years and have never had any problems with my orders. The food sometimes gets here quick and sometimes like today not so much so. 
My food has always been hot and the people have always been really friendly.
author: Robyn A.

description: Beef & Broccoli for the fail:( absolutely no taste. Like my dad always said, "you get what you pay for" More like cardboard and broccoli but I did hit them up at 9:30 so maybe their food was stale? left the whole plate...
author: Jeff M.

description: This place is really good and has inexpensive lunch specials that are actually good. I really love their salt & pepper fried fish & ditto on the fried pork chops. Their veggies are almost always perfectly cooked -- love their garlic pea leaves/shoots. The Wonton soup is pretty darned good and is my fave thing to order when I've got a cold. The beef dishes are ok but nothing to write home about. The pan fried noodles are pretty good though. And yes, they deliver! They now also have a online ordering system which I have yet to try, but I might just use it the next time I get laryngitis.
author: Samantha H.

description:
I would probably give it 3 1/2 stars but I don't think I can do that. 

Pretty good food for being a block and a half away. I mean its nothing special but when you are craving Chinese it does its job. Pretty surreal place when I go to pick up my food there has never been more then 5 people in there eating. I guess it must a delivery type place, but I would suggest the sweet/sour pork and the kung pao beef
author: Allan R.

description:
Vegan and Vegetarian friendly! When I ordered a Tofu dish the lady on the phone informed me that the hot and sour soup usually had a meat base an offered to make it Vegi. She even checked whether egg was OK. 

It was inexpensive, quality ingredients, double boxed so it didn't leak all over. It could have been spicier, the green beans were a little bland. But I'd totally go there again.
author: David F.

description:
After sixteen months of living in the Outer Richmond, I have finally found my go to Chinese food place! Where else can you order online with the details of notes and online specials? Where else will delivery be under 20 minutes, if that? And where else does the food actually taste good when prep and delivery is less then 20 minutes?

Tsing Tao, that's where!

I impressed the fiance for finding this place off an add I saw in the paper. The specials are major impressive but we ordered off their regular menu and we were not disappointed.

The salt and pepper chicken and porkshop - crispy, not too oily and uber flavorful. Only place I know where when you order egg friend rice, you actually get spoon full of eggs. Beef and tofu - great subtle sauce. Pork and fried tofu - crispy tofu skin with a sweet and savory sauce. An order of $25 gets you a free bottle of soda, even ordering two dishes and rice - it's a struggle to spend over 25 dollars here. Plus side, food feeds it least 3. Which is perfect for me, the fiance and our room mate.

Chinese food down, italian to go....
author: Jacquelyne L.

description:
I used to go to this place with my family due to it's close proximity to our old place.  The food was much better then than it is now of course (my tastes have changed).  But they still have some good meals.  Prices are fair and the atmosphere is well.. what you'd expect in a Chinese restaurant.

They used to allow parking at the Albertson's parking lot across the street, but since they have closed this isn't an option anymore.
author: Serge S.

description:
Yikes.  I am afraid I now can no longer rely on Yelp for decision-making when it comes to picking a good delivery spot.  My order, though nicely packaged (half a star) was a jumbled mess of WAAAYYYY too many scallions, elbowmeat/gristle for the beef dish, greasiest spring rolls I've ever wrung out, and lackluster spice levels despite my very serious request for spiciness.  My Sunkist orange soda and Diet Coke, although, were fizzy like I had hoped (another half a star).
Why does everyone find this so fabulous?  We were too grossed out by the looks of the beef to eat more than a bite, and the "hot and sour" soup tasted bleachy (yes, I said bleachy).  It also was not hot in any way.

Most of our 40 dollar order is now sitting in our compost bucket, with the exception of the crab puffs, which my BF ate because he was starving.   They didn't even send a menu with the delivery, which is just fine because I'd never order from them again.  Yuck with a capital Y!
author: Lea N.

description:
I can't speak for the take out...yet.

There were four of us in our party.  We decided to stroll in unexpectedly because Oyaji's- a couple doors down -was closed.  Being the only Chinese person in our group, I hoped it was good, and in the end I was pleasantly surprised!  

FOOD:  Although Tsing Tao does not carry many traditional Chinese dishes, their selection was not bad.  We ordered the following:

- Wonton Soup: Soup was good, the wontons were a little too al dente, but still good.
- Pork Dumplings:  HOMEMADE, GOODNESS.
-Steamed Whole Flounder:  The Best Dish of the night, but the others were close!
-Salt and Pepper Pork Chops:  Perfectly done, Crispy and Tasty.
-Honey Walnut Prawns:  Again, perfectly done, not too mayonaise-y.

AMBIANCE:  Very clean

SERVICE: Excellent, very attentive. 

OVERALL:  I will be back.  I hope their delivery lives up to the same expectations as their eat in.  

Don't be misled by the reviews, try it for yourself, seriously.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I love this place!  Every time I order delivery, they are always at my door within 30 minutes.  The food is great and decently priced.  This is my go to Chinese food restaurant and haven't been able to find one in the city that beats this.
author: Andi M.

description:
So much for the quick delivery I read about! I placed an order online and figured it would be pretty quick since I live half a mile away. I waited for an hour then called the restaurant. Oh yes, they did have the order and it will be there in five minutes. About 15 minutes later the food arrived but the delivery guy asked me for money. I paid online! He called in and got it straightened out but I was starving and annoyed by this point.

The food was ok. The char siu bao (steamed bbq pork buns) were a good size but full of pork fat. Sesame chicken lacked some flavor but wasn't as sticky (which I consider good) as other places.

I'm willing to give it one more chance since they don't use MSG and will hope the delivery is much better next time.
author: Barbara S.

description: I had the Chili Pepper Prawns last night. They were not spicy and they had a sweet sauce. There were pieces of cold broccoli on the plate. But there was a bottle of sriracha sauce on the table.
author: Alan S.

description: Our family loves this restaurant!  We have had so many happy meals here, sitting at their large round tables.  The food is delicious and the atmosphere is very comfortable.  Best of all, it is a family business and it's nice to watch them work together.  GREAT for a delicious, friendly, easy and inexpensive PARTY!
author: Helen H.

description: Having gone to Washington high school up the block, I gave Tsing Tao plenty of chances to redeem itself but everytime it fails, the food is always drowned in sauce, extremely greasy, and the meat is unidentifiable Tsing Tao should be experienced if you are starving to death, or extremely inebriated, but have no fear because in either case after your meal you will look back on this and say "Did I just really eat that?"...yes you did. In San Francisco we have such great options for chinese food, San Tung for one or any of the other hundreds of choices, limiting yourself to Tsing Tao is alot like playing with 2 sticks in a Toys R Us, theres much better options in front of you.
author: Sergey A.

description: I had lunch here today. The prices are definitely great. The food quality is a hit or miss. out of the last 10 times i ate there, 7 were good! i do recommend the place though. quick, cheap, fast!
author: Arthur S.

description:
Worst Chinese food I have ever had??? Probably. And that says a lot. It was tasteless - literally completely bland. It was greasy. The sesame chicken was chewy and maybe even stale. Hot and Sour didn't even have a taste that I can describe, because it had no taste.
I did order delivery at 9 pm and perhaps that is the reason. Nonetheless, I imagine anything tasting that bad at 9 pm isn't tasting remarkably better at 6 pm.
author: renee H.

description:
i LOVE their chow mein - not at all greasy, nice and "dry" if you know what i mean, and simply just plain noodles - no veggies or meat interfering with the noodly goodness.

you can sub noodles for white rice in their combos.

you can even ask for the entree (e.g. dragon beef) on the side so the noodles stay nice and dry.

and their servings are GENEROUS - i've only had their takeout, and only the leftovers hubby brings home from the lunch orders he gets delivered to his office.  now hubby rarely leaves leftovers, especially when they're this good, so the fact that he can eat enough to tide him over midday and STILL save some for me means they must serve ginormous portions.  or maybe he loves me that much that he'd restrain himself from devouring the entire thing =) i know i'd have a hard time doing the same, even though i love him more than french fries! lol
author: Jen P.

description:
I tried Tsing Tao on the basis of the Yelp reviews, and I'm sorry to say I was disappointed.  PROS: delivery was quick as they say, and the potstickers were excellent.  CONS: veggie fried rice was not fried, and veggies were scarce. Also, they gave me a different beer than I ordered.

VERDICT: Nan King Road Bistro is much better!
author: Daniel L.

description:
Just added another star to make it a full rack.  My order was placed on-line
and exactly twenty minutes later the food was at my front door, cooked to perfection.

Seaweed Eggflower Soup. Pot Stickers, and Sliced fish with broccoli, celery and carrots and mushrooms....mmmmmm...Delicious!


 A small soup is not small--it's about a quart.  


If you're trying to decide between beef, chicken and seafood, you might consider their Kung Pao Three Combo.   It adds beef and shrimp to the usual chicken entre.

They have a great list of lunch specials if you are in the vicinity of Clement and 32nd Avenue midday.
author: Philip R.

description: It's delivery so my expectations aren't super high. But my delivery order was great. They took about an hour, which in my delivery experience is typical. The food came piping hot and they were accommodating with my special requests.  The ma po tofu wasn't super greasy - not easy when it's cook with pork.  If you order on Grubhub, you have free choice of fried rice or chow mein if you order $30 worth of food. Will definitely order from this place again!
author: Kelly L.

description:
EAST COASTERS- heed my words:  all this authentic chinese food in sf is making you crave that americanized/bastardized version of chinese food.  remember the times you would get lunch special takeout for 5 bucks?  it would come with soup, a ton of the entree of your choice, and enough rice to last for days.  but you couldn't find this american chinese takeout joint in sf . . . . everything was too damn authentic.

TSING TAO is the answer!  tried the general tsaos and the beef with broccoli.  freaking fantastic.  and it came with hot an sour soup.  all this for less than 12 bucks.  

yes, i love the shanghai dumpling houses and the san tungs, but dammit, sometimes you want bastardized chinese food.  this place is awesome.   the lunch special starts at 10:30 and ends at 5 pm.  talk about a deal.  nice and clean inside too which is a nice bonus.
author: shar d.

description: I've eaten the food at Tsing Tao two times, and both times were disappointing.  Don't quite understand how this restaurant got some 5 stars from some of the yelpers.  The only thing good I see is that it is one of the few Chinese restaurants that doesn't  use MSG.  Other than that, the Chinese food is terrible.  The chicken brocolli was too saucy and the wonton noodle was bland and has very little meat.
author: Raymond L.

description:
I love their $5 lunch specials. The delivery is super fast and the quality of food is exceptional. My favorite dishes are the mongolian beef and the curry chicken. Either dish will not let you down for any of you meat eaters.

This is a really good place if you want fast, cheap, quality chinese food delivered to your door.
author: Hillary M.

description:
I used to pick up food from here all the time when my mom had to work late because I live probably 100 ft. away. 
    Now I stick to TV dinners and leftovers...
    I have to say, the food isn't that bad. It's just that I used to go there so much that it seems like everything tastes the same. I also noticed that the quality started slumping from what it used to be a while back. I agree that the fried rice is a ripoff. 
    Anyway, it's cheap and very fast, so if you're willing to sacrifice a little quality for that, be their guest.
author: AJ M.

description:
I'll be honest- it's not the greatest thing since sliced bread, but it's pretty good. I've only eaten inside a few times, as they will deliver piping hot food to my apartment in about 12 minutes. Can't beat that. 

No matter what else I get I have to have their chili pepper prawns. Fried prawns covered in a spicy-sweet-and-sour sauce? Hell yah.

For the price, the service, and the quality of food, its a staple for a quick mid-week dinner.
author: Thomas S.

description: Since my favorite delivery place closed (Family Fortune), I have found similar quality delivery at Tsing Tao.  They are friendly, very fast, and fairly priced for the quantity.  Plus, they have Fried Crab Cheese Puffs, which I realize are only for non-Chinese but I LOVE.
author: Carrie R.

description: Very good food and fast delivery. We order from here again and again. They're super fast. The food always comes 10-15 minutes earlier than their delivery estimate
author: PJ C.

description:
The food is good, cheap and plentiful.  My BF and I order from here all the time (nearly once a week) and it's always good.  Our usuals are the pork fried rice, veggie spring rolls (which are HUGE) and the rest varies but the fried chicken app., garlic green beans and potstickers are ordered often too.  The orange and sesame chicken are also great too.  

Like the other posters said, if you're looking for gourmet chinese food you're not going to find it in the Richmond but what you will find at Tsing Tao is well worth what you pay for it, the awesome delivery guys who don't question that we live literally a block away, the ability to tell them you want chicken with whatever and they'll make it even though it's not on the menu and always give us an extra cup of sweet N sour sauce for our spring rolls no.
author: Dawn L.

description:
We decided to order from this restaurant because of the reviews and it delivered.

The food was just okay, nothing great.

General Tao's chicken - battered chicken in sweet spicy sauce - average
Dragon beef - battered beef in sweet and spicy sauce - doughy, clumped in a ball... not much different from the General Tao's chicken
Salt and Pepper Pork chops - good
They didn't have Chinese Gai Lai so we got the Vegetable Deluxe - okay
Tomato Beef and chicken chow mein - okay, had better

3 stars because of fast delivery.
author: M. K.

description: Best chinese food in San Francisco.  I love their egg rolls (flaky and crispy), Lemon Chicken (they serve the sauce separately to keep the battered boneless chicken strips crunchy and great lemon flavor), Chow Mein, Beef with String Beans, and many other dishes.  Never had food from this restaurant that I didn't like.  Great for delivery too!
author: Rod L.

description:
best chinese delivery.  fresh and flavorful.  a little too salty for me, so just tell them to go light on the salt.

ordered from grubhub.com
author: Josie A.

description:
I used to frequent this place when I was in high school, since it was so close by.  Now I still frequent this place, but because their food just keeps making me want to go back.

The lunch specials are very plentiful, and they were my go-to selections when I wasn't looking to pig-out.

It's great food, great service, and parking is not too bad.
author: B F.

description: This is the only chinese food place I order from (unless it's after 10).  Their veggie spring rolls are bomb!  They are so big and cabbage filled.  I love their general chicken which is hella spicy.  My roommate always orders their hot and sour soup and swears by it because of size and spice.  Super fast delivery and good coupons.  way better than China Wok or Joes.
author: Jen S.

description:
the reason im giving this place 5 stars is because of it's awesome lunch specials. its around 5 dollars and you got A LOT of food, and soup. and the food is soo good. i got the mongolian beef special, my bf got the general chicken and both were delicious. the place is pretty big, great and quick service. if youre jonesing for some good chinese this is a good one!
also deliver!
author: Sandi V.

description: I go here for lunch a lot, but don't be afraid because lunch is $5- it is a big plate of food and everything I have had tasted great (not the best in SF, but pretty good chinese food).  Service can be a bit slow, but if you are in no hurry and want to fill up on pretty good chinese food for a really great price during lunch, I would recommend this place instantly.  I have no clue about dinner though.
author: Owen S.

description:
Best Delivery.  Best Food.  Hot and Ice Cold. 
The delivery service is also incredibly interesting.
They must come so fast because when I opened the door
the last time I saw Chang and Eng's Grandson's.
 Trust me on this one.
author: Rich B.

description:
if you like food, you should go here.
lunch specials are off the chains.  
living a block from there makes it 
super special.  
if you like mongolian, you'll love 
mongolian beef special.  its only 5.76! 
there is a worker name Benson and if you
say 'whats up benson!' like you know him,
he'll serve your food with a smile.  
he's cool though.  very nice.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Generous portions and inexpensive but sadly the food is not very good.
author: Alan T.

description: Good lunch specials at a very low price. Perhaps the McD's of chinese food. Swift, quick and not a surprise another time around.
author: Joe F.

description: I love their scrambled egg with white meat chicken. It's delicious. They also make honey walnut chicken which can be good too. Delivery is fast. Call to get the white meat only, they don't have that option on line.
author: Hayley S.

description: I've always loved them.  Super fast delivery.  Great pot stickers, soups and wonderful eggplant beef.  Will make dishes to your taste with no attitude.  This is my go-to menu for local take-out
author: Kimberly C.

description: We eat lunch here at least once each week (well, we don't *go* there--they deliver at lunchtime).  It's perfectly fine for lunch.  They do the brown rice things which my coworkers love (to me, this is kinda like having a diet coke with your box of yodels).  Also, the price is right.
author: Henry M.

description: Earlier this summer I went on an ordering spree from this place.  I was ordering once or twice a week for a couple of months.  Always the crab-cheese-puffs and combo chow fun - excellent every time!  Then I was gone for a couple of months for work.  Yet, when I ordered the other night the delivery guys says, "Where have you been? It's been a while!"  How nice is that?! Also, they are the speediest delivery place around, even though they always say 30 minutes I've had them deliver in 10 before (I'm about 8 blocks away).  Finally, I have to agree with Jen P down there, their chow mein/chow fun is never greasy - a huge plus! Love Tsing Tao!!
author: Kate N.

description: Ehhhh delivery is really only as a last resort. Not a place I'd frequent if I could crawl out of my house or get some other place to deliver to me quickly.
author: Stacy T.

description: I came here for lunch with a friend and we both had  the dragon beef with rice. It was pretty good , I had to say. I never heard of dragon beef before, so I had to try it and I'm chinese. They have  good inexpensive lunch menus which makes it attractive to come back and try the other stuff. Nice clean chinese restaurant with friendly service!Which give thumbs up from me!
author: Leon C.

description: As someone who grew up in San Francisco this was a staple both as a child and in high school. The food isn't spectacular but they have great prices and the speediest delivery I have ever seen.
author: Kelly O.

description:
Here's what the people in my house said after our meal of won ton soup, sesame chicken, and mu shu vegetables:

"Dude, I'm already farting."
"How did lunch meat get in my won ton soup?"
"Uuuuhh. What the fuck is that?"
"I think i just dislocated my rib."
"The amazing part is that I'm still eating this shit."

Yup, it was that bad. The won ton soup had strips of ham in it, the sesame chicken tasted like dirt, but without the flavor, and had the texture of silly putty, and the mushu vegetables were all mulchy and drippy. 

One star cuz they deliver.
author: jackie t.

description: It's not the best Chinese food in the City, but they give you a lot for your money. Lunch is typically around $5 and dinner around $7. I go here for the take out a lot since I can't cook and this is in my neighborhood. I recommend their Peking beef and Sweet and Sour chicken. Their dishes are a little on the salty and greasy side so be prepared to make sure you have enough time to nap once the food coma hits...
author: Natalie T.

description:
they're quick on the delivery and the wontons ain't half bad.

sometimes when i'm chillin in the richmond district, trying not to leave the house in fear of getting drenched, i call upon tsing tao chinese restaurant #1.

one order of shrimp fried rice and two people are fed.
author: Ameer N.

description: My friend Aron yaked off the fried beef here when we were in high school.  Haven't been back since.
author: Brent N.

description: When going to new places, I try to be considerate & open-minded to make sure that I have an enjoyable time.  My boyfriend & I ordered from here on our second night in the city & were severly disappointed.  The food was not well-made at all, let alone they got our order wrong.
author: Victoria K.

description: Dragon Beef. It's what's for lunch. And it's fantastic. And it's less than $5 (the entire meal). And I think you should go try it! Never had delivery.
author: J H.

description:
The food was great and smoking hot when it arrived. The delivery took less than 30 minutes. I'd recommend the fried crab cheese puffs and the BBQ pork chow mien. 

I'm definitely ordering from them again!
author: Paige C.

description: I'm still searching for my definitive "go-to" Chinese delivery place.  Growing up in Chicago, we had an awesome Cantonese place (little greasy hole in a bad neighborhood); then where I lived in NYC we had an amazing Hunan-Szechwan place at the street level of my building.  So I guess I've spoiled.  The Chinese restaurants in SF have been a huge let down.  Maybe it was the name of this place, Tsing Tao, that made us try it.  Food was ok.  Kung Pao chicken was about half green onions (which i can't eat), peanuts, red peppers and chicken chunks, nothing else, no water chestnuts to lend that nice crunch.  It was spice enough but not worth the cost considering the overwhelming amount of onions (no celery, no bamboo shoots...).  The friend prawns were more like friend shrimp they were so small, and the "breading" used was thick and doughy, not the light kind we like, and with such small shrimp it just isn't a good balance.  Wontons are even bland which is weird.  We got chicken strips for the cats but there was way too much breading and so little chicken it wasn't worth it (cats won't eat the breading).  The chicken chow mein with the $2 extra for fried noodles--I didn't expect them to use the same thick noodles most Chinese places use in regular chow mein, usually they use the thin bird's nest type noodles for the fried noodles--so the chow mein was not very good, too greasy and just didn't have that special taste the smaller noodles lend.  And the sweet and sour was ok, red sauce (REALLY REALLY RED) leaked onto everything since they used the type of disposable boxes you get at salad bars; they should have used the normal Chinese take out boxes.  But delivery was extremely fast--maybe 30 mins at the most which I wasn't expecting (they said it'd take an hour).  Food was edible but not sure we'd order again from here since I can get equally mediocre food in my own neighborhood.  We'll continue to search for the perfect jazz note elsewhere.
author: Kai T.

description: After reading that they had really good kung pao chicken I decided to try that on the lunch special which also included hot and sour soup which was ok. The chicken on the other hand was ok too but just nothing special. You do get a lot of food though for a cheap price. The kung pao had no celery and a ton of green onions. I mean they went a little overboard in my opinion. You get a fortune cookie(it was stale) and two slices of orange. All this and a coke for around $6. I don't see my self going back though.
author: Jack B.

description: average Chinese food in a divey looking spot. specialty of the house is the Dragon Beef (deep fried beef in a sweet brown sauce). not much else to write home about.
author: Jeff W.

description: ate here once, they are cheap and the food plentiful and tasty.
author: Victor G.

description: My thumb is up on this one. I live pretty near by and have ordered out and picked up from Tsing Tao enough to testify to their excellent consistency of good (not great, but good), inexpensive food. Pretty much anything you order is okay, although I would stay away from the soggy mango chicken. I like the sauteed asparagus, general cho's chicken, and potstickers (a.k.a. "slugs," as a friend calls them).
author: Patrick G.

description: The food is ok, but it is worth it because they give a lot of it. I paid for 2 people only $13, I know its really cheap. The service is pretty good, but they don't speak much English so you have to explain to them or show them on the menu what you want.
author: Nikita K.

description:
the delivery service is great..the delivery guy is very friendly.
the food is just ok, i've had better. i usually get the Crab Meat Puffs and Veggie Chow Mein..both very yummy!
author: Dwigt S.

description: The place is average Chinese food.But like how everyone has said.There delivery is super fast.I can order food and get it within 20Min's.Its cheap,fast and they give you alot.So its an average Chinese place.People always nice when i go to pick up or delivery.
author: Jonathan M.

description: I like this place. Good for dinner good for lunch good price to.. I recommend the dragon beef ! it's a nice and CLEAN place. Staff is nice especially if coming here with a big group!
author: Kristina S.

description: This place is super yummy and has quick delivery..
author: stephany m.

description: If you live in the Richmond district and in need of some good Chinese food delivered, this is the place. My food comes most of the time in less than 30 minutes! No pizza place can beat that. And they have a decent price for their food. Their service is good, the people are real nice. The food is not super great but pretty damn good. A lot better than most of the Chinese place in the city. They are fast, good service, and good tasting.
author: tai n.

description: Best Chinese food I've ever had. Fresh, light and delicious. My friend and I had the food delivered, so I am not sure about the restaurant ambiance or service, but I was blown away by the food. Amazing won tons, pot stickers and veggie fried rice. This could become a habit...
author: Kirsten G.

description: I do come here from time to time, when I need a Chinese dindin, since it's only a couple of blocks to walk. There are much better Chinese Restaurants, but I'll come pick up when I'm very hungry and don't have alot of time. Usually will order Kung Pao Chicken and Walnut Prawns.
author: M M.

description: This is not the high class restaurant that I might of imagined it to be but it is also not bad for the cheap prices that they offer. You can have a perfectly satisfying lunch that includes soup ans a drink for less than 10 bucks and we all know that we need to save up w today's economy.
author: Mickail M.

description: Tsing Tao is a very convenient place because at lunch there is a good amount of food and it's affordable for people that doesn't have much money. Also the lunch special offers soup,oranges, and fortune cookies. The waiters and waitresses are really nice and polite when you leave and enter the place. The service isn't that bad but it's worth the amount that your paying.
author: Kai P.

description: YUM!  I've had better, but I've also had SO much worse.  I honestly don't think I could microwave popcorn in the time it takes them to deliver!
author: Jerome W.

description: Ordering online was easy and delivery was lightning-fast.  I wish they taken a little longer and brought good food.  The food was horrible.  Can I give a negative 4 stars?
author: darren f.

description: My partner and I used to dine here regularly and the food was great. One night, however, the cook was either in the middle of a major meltdown or they were serving Chung-King out of the can. I ordered lemon chicken as I normally did - and normally loved. What came out of the kitchen was tough, cold, covered in fat and absolutely devoid of taste. Imagine trying to chew and swallow an old piece of carpet padding. They deducted the dish from the check when I complained but the glares I got from the cook when he sauntered out of the kitchen told me I would be wise not to return unless I was willing to risk having this fool spit in my food. If you want really good Chinese food, check out Hunan II on Cabrillo Street. Consistenly great!
author: Owen H.

description:
all you people who like this place, I want you to know this is actually terrible chinese food.  trust me, I'm chinese.

Some of the worst Chinese food I have eaten anywhere...let alone San Francisco.  Everything seemed at least a day or two old, from the rubbery vegetables in the mu shu to the stringy, soggy sesame chicken. 

One of the stranger textures of the meal was the won tons.  How did they get the meat filling so overcooked and the noodle part so uncooked?

my stomach hurts just 10 minutes after eating a small portion and I am already farting.  looks like I'm in for a rough night.
author: Aaron C.

description: Cheap and fast delivery, but the food is mediocre.  I ordered white rice, general tsao chicken, vegetable spring rolls, mongolian beef and hot and sour soup.  The dishes were bland but super spicy (heat does not equal flavor though... might need more soy sauce or salt).  The rice was soft and fluffy, so it wasn't that overnight stuff sometimes Chinese restaurants give.  It could be better...
author: F S.

description: crab meat puffs are a MUST! wow great food tastes different from other places but in a good way. prices are also on point .
author: T L.

description: I ordered take out here once because I was hungry and craving Chinese food. Found this place in the phone book, I believe, and was SOO pleased when the food arrived. I wasn't expecting anything too great since I never heard of the place, but to my surprise, the food was absoloutely fantastic. I ordered the shrimp and walnuts (the ones drenched in mayonnaise) and your standard beef and broccoli. The meal came with rice (I think) and a fortune cookie! Woo woo. Alright, so let me tell you how good I think the food is at Tsing Tao. I'm Chinese and I've eaten TONS and TONS of beef and broccoli. Honestly, I prefer not to choose that dish because it's so overplayed! Especially for us Chinese folks. Anywho, I put that beef and broccoli into my mouth that night and mmmmmmmm mmMmmm!!!!!!! And...that's saying a lot. Good portions..boy oh boy, was I satisfied. Man, I remember gobbling down the food because it was so tasty! Good price for good food. Will definitely order take out from here again!
author: Cris L.

description:
4 stars bc its chinese takeout, not amazing food, but they get an E for effort and they are the best delivery in the area.  im actually in the sunset, and they are by far faster and consistently better than anything around here.  as the previous reviews have said, their delivery is REALLY FAST.  the portions are huge, and the food is top notch for delivery chinese.  

i always order something involving spareribs (HUGE and really meaty) combination fried rice (giants chunks of chicken, beef and pork, its more like meat with some rice) spring rolls (cruchy and big) or some chicken dish ( always tasty, and like i said, huge portions). 

also, for some reason, when they deliver hot and sour soup, small means whats usually considered a large container at every other restaurant.  medium = 2 containers and large = 3.  LOVE it.

one problem though, no matter how many times you stress that you want something made extra spicy, it will come regular.  im a spicy food freak so i just toss it with some cayenne pepper, problem solved, so they dont really lose points.

HUGE TASTY PORTIONS FOR CHEAP, FAST DELIVERY.  that is all i want out of my chinese delivery, and for some reason, it is uncommon in sf.  also, they deliver till 10.  tsing tao is awesome, def worth it!!!!!
author: CC C.

description: I LOVE this food. We have never ordered a bad dish yet from this location. We normally do not try new things because we get disappointed but we have NEVER been disappointed with our take out here. Prices are very reasonable and super fast delivery!
author: Nicole R.

description: Its damn near close to being perfect; its cheap and very good with on time delivery.  What more can you ask for when your too lazy to walk down the street?!  My boyfriend is hands down the pickiest eater I have ever encountered and he loves this place.  He says they use the best quality chicken he has seen from chinese restaurants in SF.  We both love, love, love the egg rolls!  I have to say something about their crab cheese puffs...they are the most amazing little pieces of heaven you will ever eat! Other places always have too much cheap cheese in their puffs, but not this place, they have them filled with good crab meat and a great cheese.  You can actually taste the crab!  My mouth is watering right now just thinking about dipping those puffs in some sweet and sour sauce!  My only complaint, their shrimp has always seemed a bit too fishy for my tasting.  You must try the honey walnut chicken and the crab cheese puffs!
author: Katii S.

description: they delivered in 15 minutes.  unbelievable!!!  website makes for easy ordering.  wonton soup and shrimp with asparagus both excellent.  portions quite large.  plenty of shrimp.
author: Vicky K.
